Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this spot!”
Reviews.Author: cocopepper
Reviews.Content: Everytime we walked through the ridiculously crazy crowded Flamingo resort to get to our rooms at the Hilton Grand Vacations @ the Flamingo we commented how happy we were that we chose this place rather than the Flamingo hotel... No wait to check in, no crowded lobby, spacious room with jacuzzi tub, microwave, fridge, stove, etc... Very convenient location. You do have access to the Flamingo pool which is VERY NICE and there is no additional charge to enter... The Garden Deli in the Vacations property (directly across from the Flamingo Hotel pool )is quite reasonable for Breakfast... The same 'egg/bacon/cheese muffin' for $3.75 is easily$8.00 next door at the Flamingo Hotel...The casino at the Flamingo is only minutes away. as it is connected.. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “VG, but beware construction noise”
Reviews.Author: RichardinBrum
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families, because gambling is not allowed. We had a king suite (2 adults, 2 kids), which is actually two side-by-side suites, with a shared entrance-way. We could probably have squeezed into the largest one, with a bed and sofa bed. But with 2 rooms, we were positively swamped with space, TVs, kitchen amenities etc. Rooms are clean and well-equipped, service daily (the maid usually put the dish-washer on for us). No restaurant, which was fine by us, but a great litle shop for groceries, fresh snacks (wraps, sandwiches) etc. Small pool, not too busy. Easy walking distance (3 minutes) to the Flamingo and through to the Strip. Central location meant we didn't need to hire a car. Only down-side is the construction work next door, which can start as early as 6 a.m. and can be heard even in the south tower by anyone who, like me, is a fairly light sleeper. Also, the building air-con means the room has a constant low hum. I raised the issue with the staff, but although apologetic, said that nothing could be done, and did not offer a discount for the inconvenince, despite my hints. The only solution is ear-plugs. Did not attend the timeshare presentation - no pressure to do so. Would definitely stay here again with family, but would wait until construction finished next year. Taxi tip - tell the driver to go from/to the aiport via Paradise Road - quicker and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshares”
Reviews.Author: LGilker
Reviews.Content: We got to stay here for a good price as long we went to a timeshares pitch for 2 hours. We were upgraded to a free one bedroom suite because we had problems on the phone with their customer service. The rooms were spacious and clean. Nice full kitchen, jacouzi and separate stand up shower. Thee view and noise wasn't so great due to construction outside and I didn't like the long walk from their parking lot to the flamingo was sketchy at night. Amazing location when we got onto the strip. Would stay here again in the future and to bad I couldnt purchase the Hilton timeshare because it's worth it if your a frequent traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Celticgal54
Reviews.Content: We were there to tour another Hilton property but we insisted upon staying at the Flamingo property. We wanted to be in the middle of the action since this was my husband's first trip to Vegas. I read some of the reviews where people complained about the loud music coming from the Flamingo pool, but it wasn't an issue for us since we didn't spend much time in our room. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff was welcoming. They had a bus to take us to our tour of the other property. We toured the property and actually were so impressed with both the program and our sales person that we bought into the Hilton family. They give you a briefcase to hold all of the documents from the sale and we got a limo ride back to the hotel. My husband said he thought that the desk personnel were a lot friendlier when we walked in and I said of course they were, he was carrying the Hilton briefcase! We would not hesitate to stay at this property again, it was lovely and centrally located to all of the casinos and there is a monorail stop outside the door! You don't need to rent a car, but we did because we wanted to go to Hoover Dam and Red Rock Canyon,

Reviews.Title: “HGCV Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: rangerthree
Reviews.Content: This was a vacation trip and our first time to Vegas. We stayed at the HGCV Flamingo in a 2 bedroom suite. The room was great; TVs in each room, small kitchen, clean, etc. We were on the 6th floor facing the pool and there were no noise issues or disturbances. The hotel check in process was easy and the staff was extremely friendly. The location of the property was excellent and I would recommend this stay to anyone. The only two negatives I have about the property are the $5.00 charge to print off a few boarding passes for our departure flight and the spotty Wi-Fi in our room. Las Vegas has high prices to begin with, but to charge $5.00 for printing a few boarding passes is petty. Overall: recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Time share presentation stay April 9-13, 2012”
Reviews.Author: kscruiser
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location on the Las Vegas strip. As previous posters have mentioned it is a difficult place to find being located behind the Flamingo hotel. With the current construction projects that are going on around the property that makes it even more of a challenge. The construction crew starts in early so plan on hearing construction sounds at around 5am. The room was adequate. We had the two bedroom suite and 5 of us stayed there comfortably. The sofa bed was hard and typical for a hotel room. I had read in previous postings that daily housekeeping was not provided but that was not the case for us. Housekeeping was provided daily and early. The only complaint I would have about the room was that the shower water temperature was not warm enough to all of us. I am sure it was set as a safety guard but we would have liked a hotter shower. We were obligated to attend a time share presentation so that we could get a discount on the room rate. The presentation obligates you to 2 hours and they get their two hours. It isn't high pressured and something to be tolerated.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Momto3boyz
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners and got into this hotel through an inviation to tour another site in Las Vegas. We had a 2 bedroom which I think can only be obtained through time share ownership. The property in is a fantastic location. You have access to the Flamingo Hotel pools and can even charge food to your room from 3 of the Flamingo restaurants. The health club is all you need to get your workouts in and there is no additional charge. The Owners lounge is a great place to hangout of you want to and it has a pool table and ping pong ( great for families). There is also a piano on a balcony in the lobby if you wan to get some play time. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I didn't want to come home! the front desk staff was friendly and approachable, the bell hops were above and beyond helpful with taxis and our luggage. When you need a taxi they have to run over to the Flamingo cab stand and always did it with a smile. In fact when we checked out the Bell Captain came back with a stretch limo he already negociated to take us to the airport at the same price as a taxi. Our room was HUGE! It was a 2 bedroom lockout. We had a double door entry with a doorbell. It had a foyer and the kids had their own room with kitchenette, jacuzzi, TV a king bed and pullout full size sofa sleeper. Our suite was modern, clean and was basicaly a large one bedroom apt. The maid service kept our room spotless. I've never had a time share stay where there made you bed daily. The view was of the pools and each morning I woke up early and watched the sun rise up the Flamingo hotel.WOW! There is a Deli on site, a bit pricey but has all you need. There is also free WiFi which was important to my family. There was also a washer and dryer which we used everyday. There was lots of security in place and felt comfortable leaving our teenagers in the room so we could go out at night.If I could give this placde 10 stars I would. The only negative thing that I can say and it is out of the control of the HGVC Flamingo is the construction. It began at 5;30am!!!!! Thus, watching the sunrise. I had read earlier reviews on this hotel so I requested a high floor, which I got but the constrution was still noisy and began early and ended late. Apparently they are building some stores to be attached to the Flamingo and on the front of the HGVC they are building a ferris wheel. So I would recommed you ask for a high floor if you stay here. No gambling onsite but a 5 min. walk and you're in the Flamingo. I hope to come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Few Things”
Reviews.Author: RileyPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in 2 bedroom suite on the 16th floor of this hotel for a week (our son was suppose to go, but back out at the last minute). The positive aspects of the suite we stayed in are, it was two completely separate rooms, with one main door leading into small foyer and a separate doors leading to each room inside the foyer area. The main suite contained a full kitchen, living/dining area, bedroom and master bath and a washer and dryer. The second was more of a typical hotel style room with a small refrigerator and microwave. The hotels location is pushed back away from the street, behind the Flamingo hotel located directly on the strip, but right in the center of the strip, making it a quiet place, yet still being within walking distance to almost everything. The reason for the average rating, is a result of the horrible smoke smell in the main suite, and the foul order arising from the shower drain in the master bath. The stench was of raw sewage and became enhanced whenever you turned on the water on. We were later informed by the maintenance person the stench was due to all the pipes being connected to city pipes, which sometime backup and smell. The other issue with the shower was lack of hot water. During our entire stay the water only reached a temperature of warm. Additionally, the score was given due to the old dilapidated jetted tubs. The tubs were huge but very worn, and the jets, upon close inspection were not very clean. The rest of the bathroom was updated and modern. Needless to say we did not use the tub in either room. Although we didn't utilize it, the pool area was very nice. There is construction going on outside in the back of the hotel, but on the 16th floor we could barely hear the heavy equipment. Although we did not have to much interaction with the staff, they seemed friendly enough. Overall, the hotel is just slightly above average, but, with some simple updates it could be really fabulous in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: colemaggie
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was exceptionally kind. From the beginning Gina at the front desk gave our group a warm welcome and had Vegas and Happy birthday balloons delivered to our room. The commons area was always exceptionally clean and that same appearance carried over into our rooms. All the conveniences of home were available in the condo for our use. The rooms were exceptionally clean even with construction taking place between the resort and the Flamingo. The only downside was the construction is very distruptive to the pool area but, that is of no fault to the Hilton or their staff. The pool was always clean, well stocked with towels (including a fresh towel on all chairs) and plenty of chairs. Mari at the pool bar was very attentive to any drink or food needs. Great little family hotel to enjoy Vegas from without being in the constant hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: clpOhio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days during March madness 2012. This is a very relaxing property, non-smoking and no casinos but a perfect location. You can walk out a little path and be right at the Famingo Casino. This location is perfect to walk on the Strip. .Room - stayed in King Studio, bed was a little soft but room was very nice Relaxing huge jetted whirlpool tub, sink, dishes, microwave and fridge, onsite laundry , O

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break Oasis”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsVan
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week stay (RCI Exchange) - There were four of us in a one bedroom. My two sons aged 6 and 3 slept on the pull out. We were on the sixth floor overlooking the pools. We arrived Saturday night on St Patricks day. Everywhere was packed full of drunks and rowdies except for the Hilton which was very peaceful. We went to the Flamingo Club pool in the mornings and then switched to the HGVC pool at noon once the sun was overhead. It was nice you could bring in your own food to the HGVC pool area. No need to complain about the noise from the Flamingo Adult pool anymore. The jackhammers from behind the Imperial palace drowns out any music. I can see going forward this will be a main complaint about the pool area. A huge new, new orleans themed Casino is going to be constructed and I am sure many will not like the noise. We loved the huge jetted tub in the room. My sons demanded to take a bath everynight. All staff we encountered were extremely polite and helpful. Location was great. One day we walked to Circus Circus and the next day we walked to Manadalay Shark tank. Saw two magic shows -Nathan Burton (free) and Mac King ($13) Our kids also loved the birds and flamingos by the entrance to the flamingo. Vegas is not the best place for kids in general but if you do plan to take them the HGVC is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at HGVC club was very impressed. After reading the reviews, I was worried about walking to the Flamingo casino. I found the walk very quick and safe. I was traveling with my husband, son, and a friend that also had a son. Everyone was able to walk to Flamingo sometimes alone and late at night, but the walkway was lighted and we all felt safe. We took a cab to the local supermarket. It cost $20 round trip. Having the full kitchen and the grills, gave us lots of ideas of things to purchase from the supermarket. We saved a lot of money by using both. There was also a little mini mart on site and they have daily specials at a very reasonable price. I also liked not having any one pressure us about doing a timeshare presentation. We were never called. The pools was closed and they were doing construction and to tell you the truth we probably would not have use it. We went to Vegas to gamble. The location was great and I would definitely love to stay there again.. The rooms are big the one bedroom and the studio. We had a what they call a two bedroom but it was just a one bedroom and the studio.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Diskid123
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are wonderful - very attentive to special requests - made us feel at home during our stay - great recommendations to local restraunts - perfect location - just off the madness of the strip to a peacful haven.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC at Flamingo is a good change of pace.”
Reviews.Author: PA-shakes
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at the HGVC at the Flamingo. My wife and I like it because it is centrally located on the strip and provides a break from the casinos. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was perfect for our needs. Staff is always pleasant. Pantry food/prices are reasonable. Our stay was early March, therefore the pool was not open yet. There is construction going on nearby. Looks like a major undertaking that will provide close access to more shops and restaurants in 2013. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Flamingo Hilton Grand Vacations”
Reviews.Author: MimiStans
Reviews.Content: Our favorite place to stay in Vegas. Close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ashley J
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights, March 2-9 (3 nights for pleasure and the rest for a convention held at the Mandalay Bay). We had a very pleasant experience at this hotel. I will say one thing, many of these reviews claim that this hotel is all one-bedroom suites with full kitchen etc. that is NOT true. We were in a studio and the kitchen area was minimal. Had a toaster, coffee maker, sink and small fridge. The hotel is a bit old so don't expect anything glamorous, but it is clean and cozy non the less. If you are set on spending time at the pool, make sure you call ahead and ask if it will be open. We were told that the pool was closed and was being resurfaced and would be open on the 5th, but then they extended that to the 10th. The Flamingo GO pool was also closed due to early season. They did have the smaller family pool at the Flamingo open for use but it was very crowded. Just saying - do your homework before you go. All the reviews about this hotel being close to the flamingo and strip are very true. This Hilton is a great location and a short stroll through the Flamingo to the strip. Because this hotel is off the strip and not part of a huge resort it tends to be fairly quite and not rowdy like many other Vegas hotels. Good for families and working trips. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions or requests we had. There is also a decent deli on the fist floor with a small convenience store as well to stock your room with snacks etc. all in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great property”
Reviews.Author: P0cketAces
Reviews.Content: This property is technically not part of the flamingo, but is directly behind it...probably about 100-200 steps away from the back entrace....it was still close enough to the Flamingo that you basically felt you were right there. Being in the middle of the strip is a plus as it wasnt hard to walk to anywhere really up and down the strip....the Flamingo itself is better than the last time I was there. The rooms are nice...we had a 1 BR suite...I believe they are all suites....with a full kitchen, breakfast bar/ dining table, sofa which fold out -- actually pretty comfortable to sleep on Only thing that would have been nice was to have 2 bathrooms instead of 1, but all in all no complaints, and I would stay there again. I previously stayed at MGM signature as a comparison in style of rooms, and I must say at least the walk from Flamingo to this property is 1/5 of the walk from MGM to the signature...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jfulginiti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a stay here. I wish we could go back right now! The staff was friendly and very helpful. My wife mentioned it was my birthday and I was sent cards, chocolates, and balloons from the front desk. A nice touch! The hotel is not even a three minute leisurely stroll to the back entrance of the Flamingo. Once inside, the monorail is only an escalator ride and another very short walk away. We took the monorail once to MGM. In my opinion, the Flamingo is the best location on the strip. We repeatedly walked to the Venetian/Palazzo towards the north end of the strip and The Cosmopolitan towards the south end. Ceasars, Bellagio, and Paris all seemed like a stone's throw away. We had a one-bedroom suite which was perfect for the two of us. The full refrigerator and freezer with an ice maker came in handy. We had previously stayed at the HGVC on the strip near Circus Circus with another couple who slept on the sofa bed. The living room at the HGVC Flamingo is much smaller and I wouldn't want to stay in the one-bedroom suite there with two couples for a whole week. Check out time is 10am, but they let us remain in the room until noon. Our flight didn't leave until very late so the bellman offered to hold our bags. We noticed much commotion at the bell desks of the larger strip hotels at the end of weekends, but we didn't have to deal with that at HGVC Flamingo. The whole experience was hassle free and pleasant. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Alternative to the hotels”
Reviews.Author: raindiva
Reviews.Content: If staying in a mega smoke-filled hotel is not your thing, this property is a great alternative. The room set-up works great for couples, as the two bedroom is a lock-out set-up with the smaller room having it's own mini kitchen. Looks to be fairly newly updated with nice color scheme. Bed was super comfy. Staff very friendly and accomodating. They showed me two rooms and let me decide which one I wanted, as the first one looked out on a major construction project. Ask for a room away from that area as I am sure it is loud. As it is located right behind the Flamingo Hotel, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Dan H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but looking slightly tired in parts. Spacious room and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you hate the huge smokey hotels like I do”
Reviews.Author: travel JR
Reviews.Content: Located at the rear of the Flamingo Hotel property on the strip, this is a great find if you hate the giant hotels with the forced march through the smoke-filled casino to find fresh air. Great for families. 1 BR has king bed master and sleeper in LR. Even has a whirlpool in bathroom. This property has a friendly staff, clean apartments with kitchens, a deli in the lobby and free Internet at very good daily rates. You get access to all of the Flamingo's facilities without the hassles. It is right next to a monorail station so easy to get to the covention center & other LV strip locations.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment-style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LikeItLocalStyle
Reviews.Content: Quiet location steps away from the strip. The room set-up worked great for our all adult group and would be appropriate for families with no young children. There is very little noise and the location is steps from the strip. If you rent only the hotel room (without the kitchen) it includes a small kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. The concierge was very helpful and registration staff courteous - including an advance call to schedule our check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, perfect non-casino hotel near all the action”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler0009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here along with another couple. We tbooked a 2 bedroom suite that was perfect for our needs. The rooms and bathrooms are very spacious, and having a living room with a kitchen was great. As you may have read in earlier postings, the 2 bedrooms are just that, they share an entryway, but then immediately split off into two separate rooms with standard heavy hotel doors to each. Great for couples, maybe not so good for families. The location could not have been better. Out our window we could look down into the Flamingo pool, that was closed for the season. A little to the left you could watch the water display at the Bellagio. The Hilton is about a 1 min walk, if that, to the Flamingo. It's literally next door. I really loved being just a tad back from the strip, away from all the smoke and casinos. It was a little quiet oasis in the heart of all the action. You can walk anywhere from the Flamingo, which is about in the middle of the strip, very close to the Bellagio and Paris, etc. Some folks noted that there are steps from the lobby down to the desk for check-in and out. This is true, it's about 4 steps. I didn't find this an issue. You leave your bags at the top of the stairs, the bellmen watches it if being 15 feet from them is a worry. Check-in and out only took a few moments, there was never a line. Compare that to the tons of crowds waiting in line at the Flamingo or anywhere else, it was great. There is a small heated pool that the Hilton has on site, as well as a gym. This hotel looks and feels like a regular Hilton, from the rooms to the lobby. Expect the same workout machines and space for the gym. It's not huge, but it's also not too crowded, so we were able to get a good workout in without any issues. Also in the lobby is a little store where you can grab coffee, breakfast sandwhiches, deli stuff, water, beer, wine and liquor. The prices were much cheaper for water and everything else compared to the Flamingo's little store in their lobby. I recommend the property and think the service was excellent overall. Oh, and if you care for ping pong or billiards, they have tables off the lobby for that.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Vegas in December”
Reviews.Author: bettyp21
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for this beautiful resort! The staff is amazing! This is our second time staying here. First time in December. You are close to the casinos and the action but just far enought away from the noise. the Room, (a one bedroom with a full kitchen) is fantastic. We played pool and pingpong in the rec room, worked out in the workout room. it was great! I recommend this hotel anytime! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to the casino/hotels”
Reviews.Author: Indiananimal
Reviews.Content: Located just behind the Flamingo on the strip, Hilton Grand Vacations is close to all of the popular spots for shows and gaming yet you have the option to return to much more tranquil environment when you need a break. Rooms have kitchen facilities for in-room dining and the huge pool / hot tub area is well kept and landscaped for a resort experience. To further expand your reach of the monorail that services the strip has a stop just off the north side of the building, so you have easy access to that as well. Just be careful when using taxi's around the area or from the airport as Hilton has 3 Grand Vacations properties in Vegas now so make sure you are clear on the Flamingo location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice With a Few Exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Saluga
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago, and really liked this place, so we decided to stay here again. The hotel is in a great location. It’s situated behind the Flamingo hotel, and it’s an easy walk to the Strip. There’s a walkway that leads to the Flamingo, and once inside, it’s a short walk to the casinos, and doors that open onto the Strip. We stayed in a studio suite that had a Jacuzzi tub and a small kitchenette with a mini fridge and microwave. Our room was very comfortable, and housekeeping did an excellent job of keeping it clean. There was a deli on site that sold breakfast items, soup and sandwiches, cold drinks and snacks. However, there were a few issues: 1. The shower didn’t have any place to put shampoo or soap. It’s hard to juggle both while taking a shower. 2. The key cards didn’t always work on the first try. Or the second or third, sometimes. 3. The lighting on the walkway to the Flamingo was very dim. It felt a little scary walking back late at night. 4. The parking garage was located across a busy street that didn’t have sidewalks. You could use valet parking, but it cost $10.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close to strip and quiet”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were comfortable they were not up to the same standard as some of the properties in the same price range for the area. One advantage was that it was quiet and far enough away from the frenzy on the strip. Customer service was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and just steps away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: perkinscat
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath place. Very nice except, the rooms were attached by a common foirer and both sections had locking doors. Great if you are two couples, not so great as a family. Place was clean, off the strip so little noise but easy access to the strip. Free parking (a major plus) and everyone very nice. Would stay again. Didn't go to the pool because it was January. Had a great view of it and it was smallish. The adult only pool to the Flamingo next door looked good (closed for the season). Don't get conned into a $75 restaurant card for a talk. We were there almost 2 hours where they just want us to buy another timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable family hotel”
Reviews.Author: heyValera
Reviews.Content: Quite reasonable hotel in the backyard of the Flamingo, so you are never far away from the glitzy casino. The hotel itself is "reasonable" - its price justifies a lot of its shortcomings, but only to a point. So shop around. First, this is not a "real" Hilton property - this is a re-done former timeshare, and it shows. There is no Executive lounge, no room service, no upgrades (they give you 2000 bonus points), there is free WiFi, however. There is a concierge to store your bags and a tour operator to make a reservation for you.... There are steps to reach the check-in counter, so be ready for hauling your suitcases over the steps at least twice. The elevators buttons require a card at all times so your guests would need to wait for you downstairs. Two rooms share a single entrance door, so you will definitely hear your neighbor open two doors (the front and their own), which are VERY noisy. The checkout time is 10am, but the staff can adjust it to 12pm. After hours, the telephones, wakeup service and whatnot is handled by the phone operator at the Flamingo - which can lead to problems (it did for me - no wakeup call was recorded). There are rarely any taxis at the hotel entrance - you have to schlep all the way to Flamingo's taxi line to get out. a MAJOR inconvenience. You can also ask a concierge to order one for you - add extra time, a tip for a concierge, and a tad more for the taxi driver. The bedding is quite worn-out, but there is a jacuzzi in the room :) as well as a walk-in shower - so it is a good option for a short stay if you are a die-hard Hiltonite. Otherwise, you can find fantastic deals at the super hotels where everything is within your reach.

Reviews.Title: “Fab accom, venue, location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lmtighe
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on two appartments in the heart of The Strip. Spacious one bed suites with fridge, microwave, bath and shower. Allows great flexibility for self catering, we had breakfast brunch in most days and ate a large dinner out. Rooms are serviced but there's no catering, just a small cafe on site but you don't need any as the strip is a short walk away and the mono-rail is outside the door. Small heated pool, great hot tub and bbq patio. No casino so no smoke fillied areas and no noise, an oasis of calm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: usabyz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 2 bedroom suite over the new years.There is lot of space in their two bedroom units.Just on the backside of flamingo,feels like that hotel is almost on strip.Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: kkmylove23
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I felt inclined to after I read some negative feedback. My husband and I loved this hotel! It is located in the best part of the strip! It's within walking distance to all the major casinos, Flamingo next door, Caesars and the Bellagio. The hotel room itself was spacious, bed comfortable. I love the separate sitting area and kitchen. There is a liquor/convenience store located near by so you can stock up on food and drinks. I love that there was a washer and dryer located in the unit! The benefit to staying here is that there is no casino located in it, so less foot traffic and less noise. There is a small pool connected with the hotel, but you are also allowed to use the pool at the Flamingo. The only negative side is if you are staying in a room on the pool side. The music is very loud and starts early in the morning, so if you are a late sleeper you may get woken up. Other than that it was a wonderful vacation and I can't wait to return in April.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: mudandlumber
Reviews.Content: Planned to stay here for two nights but left after one. The reception area was nice and the staff were pleasant. However once you left reception the property is decrepit with a musty smell. Room was nothing special. Location is good but lots of better options. Don't waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, but good location”
Reviews.Author: MrsBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay here as we've stayed at all the other Hilton and HGVC properties in Vegas. Overall, it was fine, but nothing to rave about as many other HGVC properties which are newer in other areas. We asked for a high floor and got room 1545 which was perfect. The view was a peak of the strip, but since this property sits back from the strip, not really a true strip view as you might get at Bellagio, etc. Our room was located down a long hallway from the elevator, but we liked it as it was away from everything and VERY quite. The room was typical of HGVC properties. LR/DR/Kit combo. The kitchen is fully stocked with full-size appliances. Plenty of room for storing as much food/beverages as you wish. Didn't matter to us as I do not go on vacation to cook! The bedroom is very large with a HUGE jacuzzi and bathroom sink/drawers There was another bathroom with shower,toilet and sink/drawers. There is plenty of space in the bathroom, however they could have a larger dresser in the bedroom for clothes. Two flat screen TVs (who goes to Vegas to watch TV?) one in LR and one in BR. The room was very clean with plenty of amenities. The valets/bellmen were terrific and very helpful. There is a mini-mart type store with counter for salads/sandwiches and Starbucks coffee. The ladies making coffee were very nice and friendly. Overall, the location is best part of this hotel. It is a short walk to the casino and the monorail. Everything was fine, except the furniture and carpeting was tired looking. Having just stayed in a couple brand new HGVCs it was quite a disappointment. I would suggest HGVC on the strip, a newer and nicer property, especially if you have a car. All HGVC properties are non-smoking and non-casino properties which is a very nice escape from the rest of Vegas. We think it's the best of both worlds. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Would rate it 3.5 if I could”
Reviews.Author: LovingSunandSand
Reviews.Content: This HGV property is in the best location of the 3 in Vegas. It is located just behind the Flamingo and away from the strip. But for our taxi cab driver, he wasn't familiar with the HGV Flamingo so make sure you tell them the property behind the Flamingo or you could be paying a few extra bucks for the cab like we did. It's about a $16 cab ride from the airport so just a few more than taking a shuttle but more convenient. When you enter, there are 3 stairs going down to the check in. Either they want you to drag your luggage down those stairs (and lift them up) or they want you to use the bell service. The check in went smoothly and the front desk staff are all friendly. There is a welcome desk that you are directed to for coupons. The coupons include a free hypnotist show (you may the service fee thoughs), Margarittaville, 10% off at Macy's, and a variety of other eateries on the strip. If you want show tickets, you can get a discount but they are only offered if you sit in on one of their presentations. If you are staying here a HGV member, don't bother going. You can get cheaper tickets at the numerous tix for tonight locations. We stayed in a one bedroom which including a washer/dryer, dining area, full kitchen with coffee maker, tea kettle, dishwasher, fridge, and stove, living room with tv, bedroom with another tv, 2 sinks and counter space, shower, jacuzzi, and a closet with safe. It's big enough for 4 to be comfortable. They also have free wifi and morning paper. They only offer one housekeeping visit for a week long visit and be prepared to pay if you want it and stay less than a week. The reason I'm giving it 3 instead of a 4 is that one day they shut off the water for 8 hours. I get they needed to replace the water tank but the timing wasn't ideal for us as we like to sleep in later so we had to make sure we showered, toileted, and washed up before the cut off time. There's no casino here so if you can't get enough to hopping out of bed and onto the slot machines/card tables, you may want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zenakitty1
Reviews.Content: If you are in Vegas and there is a Convention in town and you need a place to stay. I would reccommend the Hilton Grand Vacation Club. The service is excellent, the rooms are very clean. Each bedroom has a whirlpool Spa in the bathroom. The kitchen is well stocked with plates, utinsils, pots and pans etc. Two wide screen TV's and most of all a very comfortble beds. A newspaper is outside your door every morning. Its like staying in one of the finest hotels in Las Vegas, except that the price of the room is very reasonable. When you want to gamble this club is right behind the Flamingo Hotel. You just walk around the pool area and you are right in the casino. So don't be discouraged if you have a hard time finding a room in one of the big hotels. Just drive over to the Flamingo and go around the back to the club and I will bet that you will be surprized at the price and how great this club is. Happy Gambling Jean

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is its location. You can easily walk to the Bellagio, Caesars, Venetian and the Wynn. It's also nice that they don't charge you extra for basic services. You don't pay extra to use the gym, the sauna or the hot tub, unlike some of the higher end hotels near by. Because I am a Diamond member, they upgraded me to a high floor room with a nice view of the Flamino poo. Pictures attached. They are the views from room 1135

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ebaumer
Reviews.Content: Went to HGVC at flamingo Oct 22 - Oct 29th. Travelled with myself, husband and my retired parents. Check in was very easy and welcoming. We had a two bedroom suite (with was a studio and a one bedroom attached). It was perfect for two couples, we both had or own space. Very clean and well stocked (we had to take tags of kettle and pots - meaning no one else used them). Location is perfect right behind the flamingo resort. It was a little colded out so we didn't use the pool much but it looked really nice. We had free wi-fi in our room which came in handy and were able to print off boarding tickets. Beds and pillows were comfy. Large tubs for soaking our tired feet were nice. If you want to party and be where all the action is, I recommond you don't stay here because it's quiet and not much happening on site, but again you are close to everything on the strip. - there is a safe in each room!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some help”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: Why is it that in Las Vegas, the hotels need to outdo one another but timeshares don't seem to care enough. This is the 3rd time share we have stayed in Las Vegas and the 3rd which could use some work to Las Vegas it up a bit. The location, however was the most convenient of the other 2 we have stayed in. The lobby area is nice, free wifi terrific, staff are excellent and the pool area is pretty good. We also liked their small grocery store where we could get Starbucks Lattes. But...we stayed on the 2nd Floor of the North Tower which had its drawbacks. Walking through a dismal hallway from the lobby to the North Tower to take the elevator to a floor that seemed to have only 4 rooms per floor, we felt out of touch in that area and never saw anyone else except if we looked out at the pool which was right below us and people sitting at the pool were no doubt easily able to see us if we were at the window. As a previous poster said, the carpeting need replacement and the hallways can use some cheering up. The suite itself was ok. We had a full one bedroom. The kitchen was well set up with granite counter, it was nice to have two separate rooms with sinks and if you like a swimming pool sized jacuzzi bathtub, this place is for you. The living room furniture could use an update. As far as bed comfort, I have a major pet peeve. For the life of me, if you are going to provide a duvet, get proper duvet covers with zippers rather than use a flat sheet as I am pretty sure these duvets are not cleaned in between guests. Others had commented about the noise from the Flamingo pool . We only noticed it on the day we arrived and wow is it thump thump loud. Think it's only on the weekends as we hadn't noticed it any other time. The walk to the strip is easy, either through the path to the Flamingo Hotel or a side lane off the North Tower. I was a bit hesitant about the lane but there is always lots going on with delivery trucks etc so never felt unsafe, except there are limited sidewalks and traffic so need to be careful. If you must have a car (we did), the parking garage is creepy (maybe just me), and while it is easy access from the North Tower, it would be a bit of a walk from anywhere else. I would pay the $10 per day valet and let someone else park and get your car for you. Would we stay here again? Perhaps if we wanted to have a kitchen and use our timeshare points since we got on business to Vegas every year. Personally I would stay at the Venetian or Wynn again anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms on the 27th floor in the north tower, they were very nice. The carpets were old but clean. The staff was real nice and help full. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: suffolkdale
Reviews.Content: Our first ever visit to Las Vegas and therefore to this hotel - it will not be our last on either count! From flight touch down to room it was less than an hour via cab ($17), check in was excellent/quick, no queues/lines like in virtually every other hotel we saw, and the one bedroomed room was excellent.The service throughout was first class, the Deli really handy and reasonably priced. The self catering facilities we used particularly for breakfast - healthier and cheaper! - and provided the convenience/options at other times that we needed. It was a quiet oasis central to the heart of the strip, we walked everywhere only catching the Deuce bus to Downtown and the Discount Shopping Malls. Noise from the pool? Well we were there from 14th to 20th October and didn't get any! and actually used the hotel pool 4 days in lovely sunshine. Tips? Spend 2 hours being 'sold' Grand Vacations, graciously refuse it, and then pick up some real bargains on shows and buffets as your incentive for going eg Donny and Marie tickets for $10! Go to Downtown as the sun is going down and soak up the atmosphere, even try the zip wire if you are feeling brave Dine at the outside part of the Paris restaurant - Mon Ami Gabi - great steak, reasonable prices and the Bellagio fountains right across the road. Particularly good after dark - quite magical If you do the Gondala ride at the Venetian pick the inside option and try and get a good singer - ours was great! If you are a 'Vegas virgin' like we were orientate yourself by going on the monorails both paying and free to work out where everywhere is before you start exploring on foot too much

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ProfSnap
Reviews.Content: We received a good welcome. The rooms were clean and spacious and very comfortable. Pool was great and not busy at all. One problem was the DJ at the Flamingo pool next door, over the weekend which was very loud! The Flamingo itslef was disappointing but the suites were in a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: abcdef999
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was on the side of a rural highway, I would rate it average. But since it is on/near the Strip in Vegas, I am saying Terrible. The room was OK once you adjust to the smell of cleaning products. The carpet in the hallways is just dirty and worn. The location is OK but not great - To get to Strip, it a serious walk through the Flamingo or through an alley. On the plus side, the service was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Was here for work would return again -be advised of the self parking”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Well appointed and tucked away from the strip. Note if you have a car PAY to valet the car. Self parking is in the employee garage across the street from the north tower. I was in the north tower and it was treacherous at best getting to/from the garage without getting nailed by the speeding employees of the Flamingo Hotel. They were arriving just seconds before their shift or tearing out there at high speed ala "The Streets of San Francisco" to get home. Solo female travelers would not be comfortable with distance and the dimly unmarked paths. Service was great from the staff, so much so they called everyday from the welcome center to remind me they were available. Wifi worked great in the room I was in- North Building first floor facing the pool. ATT phone signal dropped constantly in the room but worked fine outside. I would return and for the non casino crowd this property works great.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Matriarach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a two bedroom suite with my daughter and her fiance while attending my husband's sister's wedding which was at Caesar's Place. It was the perfect location being in the center of the strip and across from Caesar's. The entire place was immaculate and the staff so helpful. We never had to wait in line for elevators or to check in or get other help like I saw going through other hotels. Everyone else who was attending the wedding were staying at other resorts and everyone was jealeous of our accommodations. We hosted a barbeque near the pool for the wedding couple the day before the wedding. Tom Hickman arranged the event for us and he was the best. When some of the people couldn't make the event at the last minute and I decided to change my order, he was most accommodating. We had our own area with a grill and tables which was so nice. The bartender made the best blender drinks and bloody marys and kept up with everyone's orders. Tom made sure that the event fit my budget and was top notch. My husband said that the barbeque was his favorite part of the trip. We also enjoyed the deli on site. We would go down every morning and get breakfast and other snacks for the day. Convenient and the food was great. I also liked that it was non-gaming. As far as the complaints about the pool noise from the Flamingo, come on you are in Vegas! If you want a quiet laid back vacation, choose somewhere else than Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Travel13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations for a business trip for four nights. My husband and I have been to Las Vegas numerous times over the years and have stayed up and down the entire strip (Caesars, Signature at MGM, Bally's, etc). Since I was bringing my young daughter and husband, we decided to try the suites since we were Hilton Honors Silver Elite members, for the convenience of the kitchen and in-room amenities (washer-dryer) and the great location near my conference. We arrived late Wednesday night and were given a corner, ground floor room in the South tower. I called a few weeks before to specifically request a quiet room away from the elevator. Apparently, the message was not received as we were put into a room that was one room away from the elevator and the windows faced the loud Flamingo "adult" pool. Because of the late hour and traveling with a young child, I decided to stay in the room. Here's a summary: Pros: 1) The room size was very large (1-bedroom suite) and fairly clean. A few years back we had stayed at the Signature at the MGM so the room size at the Hilton Grand Vacations was bigger but the rooms at the Signature were much nicer. 2) Kitchen was well stocked with kitchen utensils, plates and large refrigerator (for leftovers). Washer and dryer had detergent ready for use and was a nice convenience. 3) Location was perfect. You could walk easily to Bellagio to see the water show, City Center for shopping, Venetian and other casinos. The Flamingo casino was close by so having a place to gamble nearby was nice since there is no hotel casino. 4) There was a store in the hotel to grab quick drinks, food or other supplies. Employees were very friendly and cafe (didn't try the food) seemed like it had some nice selections. Cons: 1) The hotel is surrounded by a loud and noisy pool. The music from the Flamingo "adult" pool was unbearable. It started at about 9AM and continued until 5/6 PM, everyday. I tried to take a quick nap during the stay and the dance music was pulsating through the windows. Again, I didn't complain because I believe every room in this hotel can hear the obnoxious music. Dance music is fine, but keep it in the clubs. At the end, when I complained to the person checking me out, he just shrugged and said they could've moved me to another room that wasn't AS LOUD but most rooms could hear the music. Some friends were staying in the Flamingo hotel in a high floor room overlooking the pools and you could hear the music from their room so he was probably right. 2) I enjoy gambling some but really love going to Las Vegas to sit by the pool and relax in the sun. The hotel pool had no sun until about noon. It was gone by four or five. I wasn't even able to enjoy sunshine by the pool, especially with the 90+ degree weather. The only time I had available, the pool was chilly and the lack of sun made for a cold dip. The Flamingo (family) pool was similar in that sunshine was intermittent throughout the day since the pool was sandwiched between buildings. I believe the adult pool had more sun but didn't get a chance to go there. Having stayed at Caesars where the sun shines all day long around the pool, it was a very disappointing experience at the Hilton. 3) Beds were not that comfortable. The mattress was lumpy and the sheets that they replaced on one night had a large iron stain that had a hole burned through. For a Hilton, that was very disappointing to see. How hard was it to miss a big dark brown stain with a hole in the middle of the bed? 4) The shower glass door was not a tight seal so there was constantly water from the shower on the floor of the bathroom. Overall, I would not be staying here again. There are plenty of choices along the Strip that have better amenities and nicer rooms. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest rooms I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bar10521
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently took a trip to Las Vegas and were able to stay here using a friend's timeshare points. Upon arrival we were given a welcome packet with discounts for food, drinks, souveniers, and a show. We also decided to go listen to the timeshare presentation so we could get discounted show tickets and $75 in vouchers for food and drink at roughly 20 different bars and restaurants at local casinos. All of the staff we super friendly and answered all of our questions. They even sent up a card signed by the staff and balloons for my boyfriend's birthday!! We booked a one bedroom suite and it was huge, definitely one of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in. The location was convient right behind the Flamingo hotel so we were able to get to the strip in minutes. It was also nice to have a break from all the noise of the casinos and not be hit with smoke as soon as we walked into the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and we had a large jaccuzi tub which was nice to relax in after walking all day. This hotel also has free self park in the garages it shares with the Flamingo hotel or there is valet parking for $10/day. We chose to use the valet and they were so friendly and had our car ready for us a few minutes after calling down. The only downside was the noise from the Flamingo pool. But it wasn't a major thing for us. We left the room before the pool opened and typically returned after it was closed. The only reason we even knew about the noise was a quick stop to drop off shopping bags.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location - unless you want to relax at the pool”
Reviews.Author: reevesey
Reviews.Content: I would reiterate all comments here regarding the pool at the Flamingo. Not sure what the Hilton could do about it - but the noise is constant and definitely a problem if you want to sleep or just relax by the pool. I also found the air-con to be inneffective. Having said that the hotel in general was very good. One unfortunate point to mention is that as a "grand vacations" property I was told at the front desk that they do not recognise HHonors privileges (e.g. even as a Gold member - no upgrade, breakfast etc). The property whilst providing wi-fi does not have a business centre (they do provide a couple of PCs which are chargeable).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Staff, and Rooms Get A-Plus: Noise from Pool Gets a Fail”
Reviews.Author: redink46142
Reviews.Content: Location is an important factor when you vacation in Vegas, and the HGV at the Flamingo does not disappoint. It's at the back of the Flamingo Hotel property, located mid-strip across the street from Caesar's. Other walkable properties nearby include Bally's, Paris, Bellagio, Mirage, Imperial Palace, Wynn, etc. If you're in Vegas for a long weekend and want to stay in the middle of the action, you can't beat this location. The HGV staff were very courteous and helpful. They patiently answered my questions and graciously helped me to find my way around. The concierge was not as knowledgeable as I've encountered before at HGV and Hilton properties, but the front desk service more than made up for that. I had a one-bedroom, which was perfect for me. The front desk assured me it was on the "quiet" side of the hotel. My buddy backed out at the last minute, so I had more than enough space for a solo traveler. The full kitchen, laundry equipment, wireless Internet, and comfortable bed were much appreciated. A balcony would have been nice also, but it seems most Vegas properties don't have balconies. What's up with that? Every time I travel, I forget one important item. On this trip, I inconveniently left many of my clothes in the clean laundry basket at home. The in-room laundry was a great help! I was also able to purchase supplies and miscellaneous items, such as fruit, water, yogurt, milk, eggs, etc., at the small onsite store. The noise from the Flamingo pool was very bothersome, especially my first night. I knew in advance a private party would be held that evening, but I was also told it would end by 1 am. Perhaps I was dreaming, but the bomp-bomp bass and the screams from partiers kept me awake until well past that time. The pool noise quieted down much earlier for the other nights of my stay, but the daytime noise was nonstop bomp-bomp bass and screaming. Since I was looking for a quieter place to do some business and relax in peace, I should not have selected this site for this particular stay in Vegas. If, however, I had visited Vegas to party, party, party, this would have been spot-on.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm on the Las Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: PinkDaisyDot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, just behind the Flamingo Hotel, well placed right in the centre of the LV Strip, but in its own grounds at the rear of the Flamingo Hotel. We had a one bedroom suite and had everything we needed, a separate bedroom, a kitchenette, complete with dishwasher and also washing machine and dryer. The room was very spacious and clean, nice toiletries were provided and we overlooked the swimming pool at the rear of the property. There was no noise whatsoever from the strip, although it was only less than a 5 minute walk away. The only negative comment I would make was regarding the loud music playing constantly throughout the day around the pool area at the Flamingo Hotel, this was a little annoying at times. Perhaps if the music were toned down a little and more middle of the road content was played, that would be ideal! The staff at the resort were friendly and very helpful throughout our stay, we actually got married during our trip and they made sure our stay was a truly memorable and enjoyable one!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody planning to visit Las Vegas, we would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I am used to from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MikeW82834
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in my stay at this Hilton property. The room never got cool enough, even after I turned the thermostat to it coolest setting and left it there for the duration of my stay. Yes, it is Vegas, but you are supposed to take that into consideration when you are designing the HVAC system. There was also no hot water at 6AM. When I mentioned it to the person who was trying to sell me on a time share in the property, I was told "that happens, a lot of people are getting up and taking showers then." Really? You know there is a problem an you have decided to make us live with it? No, I am not interested in a timeshare. As far as the number of people showering at 6AM, they must all have gone back to sleep after their showers because I didn't run into anyone in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Toothmom3
Reviews.Content: We are members of HGVC, but this was our first time at this Hilton. It was in a great location - right behind the Flamingo. The service was excellent and the rooms were great, as all HGV clubs are. You have access to the Flaming pools, but you have to walk pretty far to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: alertive
Reviews.Content: Really loved our stay here and never felt music from flamingo pool was too loud. Easy short walk to flamingo pool made 7yo son very happy. Will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this location!”
Reviews.Author: calypso1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as a stopover from Hawaii back to NY. This was our fifth visit to this property, and even though we have tried other hotels, we always seem to come back to the HGVC Flamingo for its smaller feel and easy walk to the mid strip. Our room was a huge 2 bedroom/2 bathroom unit with more than enough space for four. I like the fact that in addition to the king bed in both rooms, the second bedroom also has a pull out sofa. This works out great for my son and daughter. The only drawback to the 2 bedroom unit is the entryway. You walk in a set of double doors to a small hallway, then each room has a separate entrance/locking door. Each unit is self contained, which may not be ideal for families traveling with very young children. I was hesitant to leave our doors open overnight, but also didn't want to lock out my 11 year old son (entrance would have been with key entry only) in case he needed something during the night. But it all worked out OK. There is a very well stocked deli and mini mart in the lobby for snacks that was open from 7am-10pm which was nice if you needed something and didn't want to drive or walk to get it. We rented a car, but it was more of a convenience than a necessity. It is a very short walk from the HGVC to the strip right through the Flamingo lobby and casino. As mentioned in the other posts, the pool area is small, but nicely set up with a bar and grilling area. Plenty of towels, no problems getting a lounge chair either. The access to the Flamingo pool is also a plus although we didn't have enough time to use it this trip. We would definitely return to this property on future trips to Vegas! It's a great choice for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BfloRef
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at the HGVC Flamingo for a business/weekend trip. This was my second stay to this property this year. Staff is exellent and went out of they way to be helpful. My wife was feeling under the weather one day from the 110 degree heat, and they send a "Get Well" basket to the room. The only downside is the noise from the Flamingo pool is quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Times”
Reviews.Author: 2011hawaiiTraveler
Reviews.Content: HGVC prime spot in Vegas. Right in the middle of all the action on the main strip. During the evenings the rooms are nice and quite, however just a short walk to all the action. Service is excellent and the small deli on site has great prices on food and snacks. The pool partying during the day does have loud music, however it was fun watching all the people having a great time. This is not a great location for afternoon naps,, but what the heck your in vegas baby!..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel clean and typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: donnagilVirginia
Reviews.Content: The HGVC at the Flamingo is located down the street (taking the alley) from Margaritaville...and the rest of the strip, so the location is ideal. The parking is horrible--down the hill and around the corner from the facility unless you stick with valet parking (I did and it only cost $10 a day...and they only charged me for one day, not 4). The room was clean and since it is a Hilton facility that didn't surprise me, but the hotel needs updating. The location next to the Flamingo makes this hotel not so good...the loud music from the Flamingo pool is deafening and truly affected my stay. I truly enjoyed the jacuzzi in the room and the furnishings were nice. The customer service was exceptional and the valet and concierge service went over and beyond to make sure I always had a cab when I needed one (in less than 2 min time) and my excursions to other casinos and night life were varied and exciting.

Reviews.Title: “The Best TRIP EVER !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shueman1968CTA
Reviews.Content: One of the nices places i have ever stayed at. The room was great ,the staff where great. But the Valets where the BEST!!!!!!!! I think that they do not get the thanks they deserve, and to anyone reading this, YOU ARE SUPPOSE TO TIP THE VALET WELL BECAUSE THEY TRULY ARE THE ONES THAT KNOW WHERE EVERYTHING IS, AND HOW TO GET THERE!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Added to our short list for future trips!”
Reviews.Author: WasabiAZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The staff was super every single day. Maid service was perfect. The furnishings in the room were great. And the view of the pools was perfect. Less noise here than at other hotels we've stayed at in Las Vegas. No casino in this hotel resulted in less traffic and a quiet lobby - was very hard to believe that it was just a few steps away all this time and never knew about it. Will certainly stay again as it was perfect and created a relaxing atmosphere while still being close to The Strip and other casino properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Amiga9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate my daughter's birthday, and it was beautiful. The units had been recently remodeled. We had a one bedroom unit, and there was plenty of room for the three of us. The location is the best part. It is right in the middle of the strip, so that you can walk to almost everything. The staff was very friendly, and they are also able to get show tickets at discounted prices. We are HGVC owners, and we really enjoyed this property.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Relaxing Stay along the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: mytravelmom
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we used our HGVC points for a family vacation. Vegas was not our first choice, but by the time we decided when to take our summer trip, it was the onlyy HGVC resort with the availability of a 7-night stay. We were totally won over by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the cleanliness of the facilities, including our suite, plus the amenities and location of the resort. The concierge was wonderful at making suggestions about things to do, and arranged a 2-day car rental for us. We had a one-bedroom suite in the tower overlooking the pool. The room was immaculate, and everything worked fine. I loved having a washer/dryer right in the unit-- saved on over-packing. Plus the whirlpool tub was so comforting after all day walking along the Strip. The pool is not very large, but large enough for the number of people who were there. It opens early so you can enjoy it before the heat of day (over 100F). There are plenty of shady spots around the pool and walkways to escape the sun. The exercise room has good equipment and was never crowded. There is also a small deli in the hotel where you can buy coffee and sandwiches and snacks, along with small amounts of groceries for breakfast and lunch. Prices are higher than in supermarkets, but were comparable to the Walgreens we found farther up the Strip. After all this is Vegas. The location is superb. It is behind the Flamingo Hotel, and guests simply use the walkway around the pool to the front of the Flamingo to go to the Strip, or walk through the Flamingo to the Monorail to access points farther up or down the Strip. We have a teenager, and he liked the independence of being able to go off on his own, riding the Monorail then going back to the Hilton and relaxing by the pool before we all got together for dinner. We will definitely be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this location...close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: SusanP-0812
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for a very "special" birthday....My 50th was in Las Vegas!! We stayed at this hotel and loved it. It was central on the strip, so walking to different attractions was perfect. This hotel is known for it's beautiful swimming pools, there are 3 of them. The rooms were very clean and nicely furnished. We needed extra towels and toiletries (forgot my shampoo!) and room service was at our door in LESS than 5 minutes! Took in a few shows....Celine Dion at Ceasar's Palace, Cirque de Soleil at Treasure Island. Dinner at the Venetian was very memorable and also the water fountains at the Bellagio that come on to music and lights....a must see! We also did the helicopter tour on Grand Canyon, Red Rock Canyon, and the Hoover Dam.....ALL a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Great Timeshare in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrankLisaNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The HGVC at the Flamingo is one of the nicest timeshares you can stay in. The rooms are what we expect from Hilton which means they are roomy, nicely decorated, very clean, and comfortable. The pillows and the king bed are the same we are accustomed to when we stay at Hilton hotels. Being a timeshare, and not a resort, you need to go off property for most activities. We ate at restaurants on the Las Vegas strip and swam in the Flamingo pool. All of which were great. The Flamingo pool has a young and fun crowd. The HGVC is adjacent to the Flamingo so during the day you hear the music from the pool but we did not find it troublesome. This property is located in the middle of the Las Vegas strip which gives you easy access to many casinos, shows, and restaurants. Note: We are owners of a HGVC unit in Florida. This was our first stay at the HGVC at the Flamingo and we would definitely stay at this timeshare again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: dollie4444
Reviews.Content: We have owned here since 2001-always loved this property, we also own a 3 Bdr.penthouse at HGVC on the strip. But hardly ever stay there. Last year we stayed a week at the Vdara property, it is fabulous. We have also stayed at the Hotel, Luxor, Mirage,PH, Ballys, Wynn. Since here, altho we paid extra HOA fees to have this property updated, the new shower still leaked (was supposed to be fixed) around the new glass doors, we had to use our towels to wipe up the water. Luckily there is a washer/dryer-we are in a 1 bdrm. The toilet didn't work properly the maintenance had to replace the entire guts of it. They shut the water off last night for 3 hrs at midnight, which was fine they gave plenty of notice, but this morning shut it off at 10am for 3 hrs, with a notice of just a message light on the phone. I have to say that as an owner this HGVC caters only to paying guests or to prospective timeshare owners that they give deals to at this property or the strip property. You can stay at better properties (Vdara) that give you deals. They have fenced off the Flamingo pool, and the music is loud, but we really don't mind that, it is fun to watch. The staff here are very helpful, except for the manager. We left a call into her -never received a call back. The internet is so bad that you have to keep logging into it on the hour, just ridiculous. The last time we stayed, (cause it is very slow) you call the desk they give you a # to call to complain about it, they manage the internet, they always say reboot, but always have done something that makes it faster. Most TVs in hotels are hidef by now, these are not, and the start up screen guide is all fuzzy. As HGVC owners, we belong to HH-we stayed in 26 hotel rooms in June alone- high end- but this property is going downhill, and it used to be our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “nice spot”
Reviews.Author: plpl
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week in july... our room had a kitchen area that came in handy. we walked to walgreens and got healthy food for breakfast and lunch...(cereal and sandwich stuff )...then we had dinner out each night... the pool was great..no problem getting a chair...plenty of shade..you can bring your own beverages and food to the pool..if you want to buy beverages and food, prices are very reasonable... only problem with the hilton pool is that you can hear the music from the flamingo and it's loud dance music..not great for relaxing... you are allowed to use the flamingo pool and we have in past years ..but, this year we tried it one day and not again...the flaming pool used to be a mixed bag of singles, familes, and couples...now , they turned it into a singles party..no kids allowed...music so loud you can't talk...etc... fun for some...but a bit much for us.... the location of the hitlton is primo...the staff was friendly..the room was clean and service was great...

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: tlkrumm
Reviews.Content: My husband, friends, and 21 year old daughter used our time-share exchange to stay at the Hilton Flamingo AND the Las Vegas Hilton on the strip. Both were great ... but here are the details on the Flamingo. First of all, if you want a non-smoking room, make sure your timeshare company knows that and passes on the information. When we arrived, there weren't any non-smoking rooms available. However, the staff went above and beyond to make us comfortable. They immediately brought up a machine to remove the odor (it worked) AND they moved us completely the next day. It was no trouble at all, and illustrated exactly how customer service should be. Speaking of the staff, this property is small enough to really build relationships. The bell staff (especially Josha) and all the valets were personable, professional and went above and beyond. We stayed in the two bedroom unit in the main building. The beds in both rooms (and the linens) were very comfortable. My daughter said the hide-a-bed wasn't too comfortable, but I have never slept in one that was. The unit was clean, had all the kitchen things we would need, and the decorations tastefully done. We went to Costco and bought some groceries (and alcohol). It was about a 10 minute drive and well worth the time spent. I read some reviews about the noise from the Flamingo pool. We could definitely hear the pool during the day, but it wasn't annoying, especially since the pool closed at 6pm. We actually liked the music from the pool as it added a "party" feel to our pool. My daughter chose to use the pool privileges at the Flamingo, but it was a little too much of a "party place" for our tastes. The Hilton pool was just a regular pool, but they have nice chairs, a BBQ area and was clean. We didn't have any problem finding chairs. Overall, I really liked the location (right behind Flamingo) with it's easy access to the Strip and the monorail. We also liked the atmosphere of the hotel. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with one disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: NorthVanFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: We loved almost everything about this resort, it was easily accessible to the heart of the strip, but situated behind the Flamingo so it was not as big and busy as other hotels. The rooms were clean, and large with nice kitchens and insuite laundry (which was perfect for our family who had already been on the road for a week). The staff were all friendly and very helpful, so except for one major complaint we had a fabulous stay. Our only disappointment was that we found out at check-in that we weren't allowed to use the Flamingo Resort's pool because it was an adults only (18+) party pool so our kids (ages 15 & 17) were not allowed to go in. The Flamingo pool is now completely fenced in, with security guards at the entrance and loud music blaring from 10 am - 6 pm daily. We were able to use the Hilton's pool, but it was very small and not at all like the "resort" pool we were expecting. I have stayed at the Flamingo in the past and really liked their pool facility so this was one of the main reasons for booking at the Hilton GVC. It's too bad that the Flamingo is catering only to the 20 - 30 year old party crowd, there are many other people who would just like to relax around a beautiful pool without "strutting our stuff and drinking" all day. Other than the pool issue, we had a great time in Vegas and at this resort, but I'm not sure if I'd stay there next time ... I'll still be on the lookout for the perfect place... central location, big rooms with kitchenettes and a beautiful pool and not too expensive... I'm not sure if a place like that actually exists, so this one was pretty close.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Customer service!! Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Boxter51
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over the last four years, and we are never dissapointed. Francisco at the front desk always so helpful and remembers us by name. My only minor complaint would be they need more bellmen during checkin. All the employees make you feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great place close to the Strip but not in it”
Reviews.Author: sometrip
Reviews.Content: A one bedroom condo that is totally isolated from the Strip so that you can ignore all the noise and people to get away for awhile. Then, when you want the Strip just walk through the Flamingo and there you are. It does not get much better than that. You can enjoy the peace and quiet of the HGV private pool or join the "booty shaking contest" of the Flamingo pool next door. Nice sandwich shop in the HGV as well when you don't want to fight the crowds for lunch or dinner or fix your own in your full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: marsom
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas with our 2 young children and stayed at HGVS for 7 nights. Our extended family stayed at the Flamingo Hotel, which was just steps away. Gina at check in was so kind to recommend the South Tower for us to stay in so we would be closer to them. That was great advice, which made our whole trip so much easier, especially getting around with a stroller. It was steps to the Flamingo Hotel and the strip. Our room was very nice and spacious. There were 2 flat screen TV's, one with a DVD player which was great for the kids. We had a 1 bedroom suite with plenty of room for a crib. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but the Bellman, Robert was so kind and held our luggage until our room was ready and brought it up promptly. My husband left his drivers license downstairs at the cafe and didn't even realize it until Robert called the room to inform him and he got it back within minutes, which we were very grateful for. Housekeeping service was excellent, we always came back to a clean room with plenty of towels. We requested clean towels on a day when we left the room too late for housekeeping to clean, and they were there in the bathroom when we returned. The security for this hotel is also excellent. A room key is required to get into the tower buildings as well as up the elevators. I felt very safe coming back at night with the children. On our seventh day, my room cards had deactivated and I couldn't get up the elevators. I called the front desk from the phone located by the elevators, the front desk sent security immediately. A very kind man, Kevin, came and got us up into our room. He even went and got me new room keys and brought them back to me up in my room within 10 minutes! Being by myself with kids, he saved me the hassle of having to walk around the building to the front desk and wait for keys. I can't thank Kevin enough for his professionalism and kindness. The entire staff at HGVS is what made our stay such a great experience. I'm sure there are nice suites at other locations, but unexpected things happen when you are on vacation, and it nice to know the people that work here truly care and want to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but some negatives”
Reviews.Author: kuppkake
Reviews.Content: .my husband is on business and i stay at the hotel all day....there is a deli on the first floor that sells breakfast and lunch sandwiches,etc; the pool is small, but adequate..the first day, i ran a tab at the pool for food and drinks...when i reviewed my bill, i had been charged for 2 extra drinks that i did not have...the only separation between this pool and the Flamigo pool is a wrought iron fence and a few bushes...you can't see the "action" at the Flamigo pool, but you cannot avoid hearing it....at noon everyday, the "music" starts....the "music" plays f\rom noon til 6pm....the awful thumping bass sound is unbearable...like waiting at a traffic light with a bass beside you in another car..you can hear it in your room all day...they have a booty shakin contest, limbo contest, etc...you can hear it, but not see it, unless you desire to go over to the Flamigo pool....also, when we checked into the room, there was a nasty sock over in the corner and one ot the kitchen drawers had a ziplock bag that was used to wrap a used piece of chewed gum...so far,(3 days) we have had no offer of housekeeping....you have to take your trash to a chute...i scored some TP from a hall restroom...we went over to Flamigo for dinner...the sushi place cost the 2 of us almost $90 (including tip) just with water as a drink...Johnny Rocket's (for 2) cost almost $40 with tip) found out the diet cokes were $3.50 each....will follow up after our stay is complete

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 4deb
Reviews.Content: Everyone we encountered at this hotel was pleasant and helpful. The resort was clean, and it offered a great location. We were directly behind The Flamingo - which connects to the monorail, as well as being on the strip. The Flamingo is on the strip - this hotel (non-gaming) sits behind it, so 1 block back from the strip. This did not hinder us in any way. 2 bedroom unit - large bathroom areas, comfortable beds, spotless kitchen and living room area. I would stay at this location again.
