Reviews.Title: “Great Facility In Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Suefranss
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation Club is right behind the Flamingo on the Strip. It is far enough away that you have complete relaxation and comfort, but close enough that you can easily walk to your favorite places on the Strip. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite with friends. The kitchen is very nice to have when you don't want to get dressed just to have a cup of coffee. The rooms are nicely appointed, clean and well-stocked. The staff was very helpful. We really like that we can escape the frantic and smoke-filled Strip for our little place of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Najebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights from April 10 to April 13. This was our second visit to Las Vegas, the first time we stayed at the Venetian but decided to for the HGVC as we wanted a unit with a kitchenette: we were 3 adults in the units. The Hilton Grand Vacation Flamingo is a great place to stay as it is right behind the Flamingo, thus steps to the strip we walked everywhere and only took a cab a couple of times. The check-in went very smoothly and we could go to our room directly even if we got there early. Our unit was just as expected: very spacious, with a view on the pool area. The bed is very comfortable and the sofa bed seemed very comfy as well as my friend slept perfectly every night. The kitchenette is practical for drinks and snacks but there is no cooktop or regular oven. I guess you can heat up some soup in the micro-wave but we didn’t. The décor was fine, modern but pretty “Hilton-kind-of-plain”. The bathroom was spacious but lacked a bit of privacy as the sink and tub were directly connected to the room. The resort is well kept and has all the modern amenities one would need while on vacation. We appreciated the absence of a casino in the lobby as we didn’t have to breathe the constant smell of smoke. Guests could have access to both pools from the Flamingo and the HGVC. The HGVC’s pool was way less crowded so we stayed there the whole time. They provide as many towels as you need and there are plenty of long chairs all around the pool. There are some BBQ as well, which we used one evening with about 10 friends. It wasn’t a problem for us to have guests from outside the resort. The pool bar is great, we enjoyed our cocktails in the pool very much! We liked the HGVC Flamingo very much for its location and its family feel, so we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Best Place to Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PoolPiacasso
Reviews.Content: The staff was far above expectations. They worked to make sure our stay was magnificent. Nice facility. I love that it's 30-40 steps from the valet to the elevator. I don't have to fight my way through a casino to get to my suite. The convenience store on property is an excellent value. I had friends that were staying at the Flamingo that would walk over to the Hilton to buy groceries etc. I will never stay anywhere else when I am in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: elwitty
Reviews.Content: I used my timeshare here for a weeklong stay in a 2 bedroom at the HGVC Flamingo. There is no perfect hotel or timeshare in Vegas....but this place is great and does everything it can to fix any issues. As other reviewers have indicated, there is some DJ noise from the pool, but you can avoid it by making the right pre-check in requests. During the middle of our stay we had an issue with a toxic smell coming out of the master bathroom, but the hotel responded well and switched us to a new unit once it became available. They also gave us a small snack basket-gift to apologize for the inconvenience. The bellmen, front desk, valet, and pool bar hosts were all great. The Flamingo pool is a full on adult party until 6 pm and the kids pool at the Flamingo gets packed on weekends. The HGVC owner pool, however, was always available and had seating, even on fourth of July weekend. It is slightly heated in the day, and very warm at night. The drinks and snacks are cheaper at the HGVC pool than the ridiculously priced beach cafe at the flamingo pool or the drink stands. You can also get patio/cabana tables at the HGVC pool and have barbecues. Everyone in our family, the adults, the kids, and my elderly mother, had a great time. The Welcome Desk can be a little pushy with trying to get you to go on a tour, but if you stick to your guns, they will leave you alone. You have easy access to the flamingo, caesar's, harrahs, mirage, ballys, paris, bellagio, and planet hollywood. All in all, this place is nice. It is not the Bellagio or Wynn, but if you are taking more than 2-3 people to Vegas and need more than one room, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this hotel---it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Shaun_Azzopardi
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 11th of June after a long flight from Melbourne, Australia and stayed for 5 nights The exterior of the hotel was very clean and welcoming and the room was excellent. It was clean and spacious ( we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite) and it was fully equipped with kitchen facilities, spa, two lcd screens, sleeper sofa bed The outdoor pool and jacuzzi was nice The staff were great and attended to any needs that we had. Hotel is also is close proximity to a grocery store for everyday needs and walking distance to the las vegas strip We will definitely stay here again Shaun

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay - great location!”
Reviews.Author: TCLP2010
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed here in May 2011 for our first trip to Vegas. We loved the location of the hotel it was an easy walk through the Flamingo out to the strip every day. The room was very nice and clean. We had plenty of space for all of us and the kitchen was a plus for breakfast in the morning and storing waters for the day. You felt secure while in the hotel - you had to use your room key to get around (doors and elevators). Their store/cafe had a nice $2 wrap and chips deal which was a perfect snack. They also had free cucumber water which was good. The only downside is the parking(free) it is far away and through an alley way. We walked through it late at night and had no problems though. Free internet is a plus :)

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Pam255112
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple in Oct 2010, what a great experience. We stayed in a very large apartment with full cooking facilities, laundry etc and it was great. The apartments were roomy, light, well furnished with a pleasant decor and also very quiet. We were right on the strip but the resort was an oasis of calm. The outdoor pool area was superb and you felt like you were miles from the frantic pace and noise of Vegas right outside the gate. Excellent spot for walking around and along the strip and handy to all the eating and nightliofe you could want.

Reviews.Title: “1000 sqft space with fabulous views of Flamingo Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Awful_Kgp
Reviews.Content: A RCI holiday option which we took up for a weeks stay at Las Vegas which was an adjoining property to the Flamingo hotel --the suite was huge with two jacuzzis, two full bathrooms, one big and one small kitchen, two large king beds --pull out beds etc etc in terms of facility it could not be beaten --- stayed with a friend and yet there was enough room for us --& more if there were ! We were on a higher floor and loved the views from the huge glass windows ---lot of entertainment and restaurants within easy walking distance

Reviews.Title: “We'll never stay at the HGVC Flamingo again, and we're owners”
Reviews.Author: JAXJWW
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this HGVC several times since 2003, and we told the management this time that we'll never stay here again. It's a shame, too, because the property is really nice as is stated in other reviews. If you are looking for a peaceful stay, as we were, this is not the location. The Flamingo Hotel/Casino begins blaring music from their pool about 10 a.m. every day, and they do not shut it off until about 6 p.m. It's loud, throbbing music with heavy bass that you clearly hear even in your room with the doors closed, because they have big speakers pointed right at the HGVC at the property boundary. The HGVC manager told me that they've unsuccessfully tried to get them to change it. The Flamingo has also erected a fence between the properties, so you have to walk around to an outside entrance and be processed through an airport security type station and get an armband after having your bags searched in order to enter the Flamingo pool area. Before Hilton sold the Flamingo to Harrah's you could just walk into the Flamingo pool area right next to the HGVC, which was very convenient, and then on into the casino. We went once to the Flamingo pool during our stay this month, but we left after about 15 minutes because of the loud music. You now have to walk around in the street (no sidewalk) to get to the Strip, too. We'll use our HGVC points elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: zinctop
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas several times in the past, this trip was primarily in order to try the new Skywalk at the Grand Canyon. We chose the Hilton Grand Vacations because of the reviews provided on this site and we were more than pleased with our choice. From the welcome at check-in to the quality of our room we could not find nothing to fault. The staff were extremely helpful and the service provided was excellent. Our studio room was clean, quiet and had a nice view overlooking the Flamingo pool area. The fitness room had a good array of machines for those who felt the need to exercise off the large Vegas meals and whilst the pool areas was immaculate with plenty of towels available for sunbathers and swimmers, it would have been nice if the area had been a little larger (plus the sun doesn't hit the pool area until after 10 a.m. which was a little inconvenient because we like to get two or three hours sun early so the rest of the day can be taken up with other things.) You can make use of the Flamingo pool, but from what we could see that got very crowded and noisy. However, that did not detract from the enjoyment of our visit and we would certainly go back. Car park was located around the corner from the entrance of the hotel, but only a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fabdiners
Reviews.Content: We are HGVC members and decided to use points for a trip to Vegas last year. We booked the Flamingo due to the central location but were very disappointed with the quality and general cleanliness of the public areas and our one bedrom suite. The check in area was clean and failry ok but there the positives ended. We made our way to our room through dirty carpeted corridors that looked as if they hadn't seen a vaccum in months. There was a damp and dirty odour throughout and when we got to our room it was very dark and dingy. We tried to get over the disappointment and unpacked then went for a walk along the strip. Whilst walking back to the suite I decided I would mention my concerns to reception. The gent we spoke to seemed very surprised at my opinion but he did offer to put us in an alternative room, he came with us to show us another room a few floors up but it was exactly the same. I was beginning to feel that our expensive purchse of HGVC points was not rewarding us with good accommodation!!!! I said I wasn't happy with the cleanliness of the rooms, especially the walkways and public areas. The noise from the pool area was alarmingly loud also which was rather annoying. We asked to be transferred to the HGVC on the Strip, the gent was very helpful in organising this for us ao we quickly re-packed and made our way down there. The difference is quite remarkable. I was stunned when we checked in. The building is much newer granted but the quality is far superior and super clean. We were in tower 2 with a fabulous view. Comfy clean beds, lovely lounge, bedroom and bathroom. The fully equipped kitchen was fabulous for keep our drinks cool and for preparing our breakfast and light snacks. Its abit further away from the hustle and bustle of the strip but we used the regular bus for a few dollars for three day ticket. Although we did walk up to the middle of the strip every morning which took about 15 minutes and provided some light excersise too. I can absolutely, without hesitation recommend this hotel if you are looking for something a little quieter and 5* quality. After staying there last year we have booked again for September this year and we can't wait to get back there. We have been to vegas 8 or 9 times now and stayed at Caesars Palace and the Bellagio and the HGVC on the Strip is better than both.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Likeness
Reviews.Content: I was her for a convention at the Flamingo and stayed here to get away from the constant crowds and noice. The service at this hotel is excellent. Anything that goes wrong, they are there to fix it in minutes. If you need something, they will get it for you. We had the concierge get us show tickets and change a dinner reservation for us. They have a deli/store on the premises that has everything you could want to cook in your kitchen or they make fresh sandwiches and have killer shrimp cocktail and Starbucks coffee. It is a short walk to the casino and beyond that is the Strip. You are right on the monorail too. They also have a private pool with a pool bar. Loved the bartender! What a great guy. If they don't have what you want, he will get it for you. The prices there are much better than at the Flamingo on food and drinks. There are quiet spots too where you can sit and read a book or relax. I liked this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot just off the strp!!!”
Reviews.Author: letsgo1984
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the first week of May for a long weekend get-away. It was perfect. The rooms are very new, nice and clean. The lobby is fairly modern and the staff was very friendly. It was relaxing coming back to a non-smoking, quiet hotel after a day at the pool or a night of partying in Vegas. It is located right behind the Flamingo Hotel/Casino. Just a few minute walk from the Hilton to the Flamingo hotel which is right in the middle of the action on the strip. We also saw the "O" show at Bellagio, which was fantastic. If you want a smoky, loud, party hotel/casino this is not the place for you. If you want an escape from the slot machines and smoke, but still want to be really close to all the action, this place can't be beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jod006
Reviews.Content: haviing travelled from aust and trying to adjust to timezone the noise from the flamingo pool was deafening. Even with ear plugs in the thump thump from the flamingos pool party was beyond ridiculously loud. And you couldnt get away from it. And when we did recover from jetlag guests at our hotel were not permitted entry. apparently flamingo is no longer owned by the same company. we stayed here hoping for a bit a peace and quiet away from the hussle and bussle.Which was clearly not the case. great sized rooms though the cleaning service was a little lax with toilets not being cleaned during our stay. I would never stay here again no matter what. The last thing anyone wants while in Vegas is to be woken up every morning with seriously loud music and thud thud from a boom box. I was told by management that nothing could be done about it and constantly put on hold. then hung up on.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a mid-strip location, particularly for families.”
Reviews.Author: KWLV
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Easy access to mid-strip with the ability to take advantage of amenities (ie pool) at the flamingo. Nicely decorated suites afford plenty of room to spread out. I've stayed all over Vegas but may never stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT facility and location and the staff was FANTASTIC. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Foxgolf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a vacation at this location and we had a GREAT time. We are Disney Vacation Club members and exchanged some points through RCI for a week in Vegas. A week in Vegas can be a long time but we had some day trips planned so we thought a week would fly by pretty fast and it did. My wife and I are not real "needy, pay attention to me" type of people. The more simple, the better. Our intention for this trip was to relax and enjoy the great weather, see the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam, see some shows, gamble a little bit and spend some quality time around the pool. We were not disappointed with anything we did. If you are reading this review I think the information you want the most is what we thought of this facility so I will address that first. Check in was very easy and fast. We got there early and they were able to get us a room right away. The room was on the 2nd floor which turned out to be perfect as we were able to use the staircase in the main lobby opposed to having to use and wait on the elevator. We then did the "welcome to the hotel" spiel and what they were offering for "the tour/timeshare sales presentation" was not to our liking so we said "no" and that was the end of it with no pressure again to participate which was appreciated. When we arrived in our room we were very pleased with what we saw. We had a one bedroom and there was plenty of room for the two of us. We liked the way it was setup and the decor. As we moved around the rooms we discovered a couple issues and thought it was best to address them immediately. The TV in the living room was not working properly, the safe was locked in a position where we could not use it and there was some food crumbs around the coffee table in the living room. I called the front desk and they were very sorry and offered to move us to another room but we said that was necessary but would like to have the issues fixed and they sent up a maid and a maintenance man within minutes. Everything was taken care of very professionally and the employees were very friendly and apologetic. I was very impressed with this reaction from the staff. We also got a phone call an hour later checking to make sure everything was taken care of to our satisfaction. They even offered us some free credit in the snack shop which we declined as it was no big deal. We never had any other problems at the facility the rest of the vacation. The facility was bigger than I had imagined and was very clean. The pool is in a gated area and it not huge but was very well laid out. Never had any trouble getting chairs and the towels were just inside the gate. There was a small bar where you could get some snacks and drinks which was convenient. The one issue you had if you wanted to get some sun early was the main building blocked the sun at this time of year from hitting the pool area until about 10:30am. We both got early and wanted to hit the sun a little earlier than that so we used the Flamingo pool for this which opened at 9:00am and there usually was a line waiting to get in but it moved pretty fast. The drawback of the Flamingo pool was it was not heated and was pretty cold in my opinion. The HGV pool was a lot smaller but it was heated and I used it numerous times. I found the crowds a lot younger at the Flamingo and a little more our age at the HGV pool area. The music was a little less loud too. The location of the HGV @ the Flamingo was GREAT. It was just a short walk around the Flamingo pool to the Flamingo casino and gift shops (3-4 minute walk and you were on the strip). We elected to not get a car and used the buses (RTC) to get around which worked out perfect. There were stops on both sides of “the strip” almost right across from the Flamingo which was very convenient. We used the bus system last time we were in Vegas and knew the ropes for getting around. We saw to Cirque shows "Mystere" and "KA" and really enjoyed both of them. If I was going to see one of them again I would choose "Mystere". I'm sure I would see many things that I missed the first time. Show tickets can be a little pricey but they really are worth the money. The day trips we took to the Grand Canyon (south rim) and the Hoover Dam were fantastic. The GC tour took about 14 hours and the HD tour was about 5-6 hours but well worth the time and money. Took the bus to the downtown casinos (Fremont Street) and enjoyed the “Freemont Street Experience – light show” which was way cool. Well worth the trip to see and watch the people in the crowds which can be a show in itself. In summary, we thought the HGV @ The Flamingo was an excellent facility and hope to visit again in the near future. I would highly recommend it to you and any of my friends. My only negative experience in Vegas is with the people on the sidewalks trying to pass out there prostitution flyers and cards to anyone that walks by them. I never made eye contact with them and pretended they did not exist but it was still a constant annoyance. Unfortunately there is an area out in front of the Flamingo Hotel that they use constantly. If Vegas could get this problem fixed it would make going to Vegas much more enjoyable. Remember “what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas”. Have a GREAT trip. Brian & Susan from Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: jgallag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after Hilton offered a time share request. $189 for two nights. $30 in gaming and $100 gift card at the LAS Hilton hotel (not the grand vacations). In addition, $200 cert for one night in the next 6 months at a hilton hotel in the continental U.S.A. as well as 15K HHonors points. A decent deal. The front desk checked us in ~ 12:30 which was nice but the room was not finished being cleaned when we got there. It was like a college dorm with a hot tub. One of the hot tub spouts popped out when we were trying to use it. The part about this hotel is the location. You walk through the Flamingo to get here. The Flamingo is in the center of the strip so great access. It is also a stop on the rail system here which is very easy to use and convenient. $12 for an all day pass on the rail. The "talk" where they try to sell us a time-share takes about 1.5 hours. It is one on one or for us one on 3 (me, wife, and child). Really nice people doing the time share, but in our opinions, time-shares are a total waste of money. PM me if you want more specific info.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem in Glitter City”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at HGVC Flamingo and had a wonderful time. The unit was really close to all the action, yet was a quiet haven when you needed to get away from all the stimulation of the Strip. Right across from Cesars and you could see a part of the Bellagio fountains from the room. The unit was very comfortable and well stocked. All appliances were updated and the rooms each had a wall mounted flat screen with a wide selection of channels. There was free wifi in the units and the HGVC offered free printing of airline boarding passes. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all a really wonderful place to spend a week in vegas. We will definitely return to this resort. Plus; each unit was comfortably furnished with enough furniture to provide ample seating. The full kitchen was well appointed with range/oven, microwave, fridge and dishwasher. Coffee maker and toaster. The unit also had a stacking washer/dryer. The resort had a fitness center, pool, sauna, hot tubs. The on site deli/store offered quick pickup meals, the sandwiches were very good. You could also get some basic supplies here (milk, cereal, etc) but you better bet is the grocery just down Flamingo. this resort is right off the Vegas Strip (right behind the Flamingo Hotel) so very convinient to all the action, or if you want to go the other way, very east to go out of town. Perfect location.Check in and check out was very quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Pool Access - Good Staff (Check Out too EARLY)”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We were in town for four nights staying three of them at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at the Flamingo. (HGVC-F) Being center strip, having a nice room, and access to nice pools was a must....but we did not want to spend crazy money for the stay either! Finding this location was very easy using our GPS. They have short term self parking up front while you check in and take your bags to your room. The front desk staff was courteous and helpful. They had a room ready for us for early check in as requested but we decided we did not like that room, and opted to wait for a room that was in the main tower, up high, with a straight on view of the pool at the Flamingo. (High room gave us a sliver of a view of the strip towards Paris) We chose The HGVC-F because it had full access to all the pools at the Flamingo, but was a non gaming property. (Yes, they do have access...the reviewer that said this was not the case was wrong...maybe they tried to take their kids to the adult pool?) . The lobby is of acceptable size and welcoming with a breath of fresh air by not having to walk through a smoky casino. The room and bathrooms are nicely appointed and are very roomy. We booked a studio but opted to do a standby upgrade to a 1 bedroom for $19 per night. (If we booked a 1 bedroom it was $39 a night more). Room decoration is warm and they are very well kept. It was worth every penny to upgrade to the 1 bedroom. The room had a living room with sofa bed, kitchen table, full kitchen, washer/dryer, large bathroom, two person whirlpool tub, full shower, king bedroom (fully closed off from rest of suite). The room had plenty of desk space. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel had plenty of TV Channels and flat screen TV's in both the bedroom and living room. Climate control is acceptable and you can leave the blower motor on for white noise while still using the climate control. Absolutely no noise from the nearby strip, but yes you will get noise from the Flamingo pool during the day but it is only from 9am to 6pm so should not be of any consequence, and it is fun to people watch out your window. Regarding housekeeping...there seems to be some confusion on the board.....let me sum it up....if you are staying as part of the timeshare, you do not get daily housekeeping, but if you are booking as a traditional pay customer, you WILL get daily housekeeping. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job of meeting our needs. (Even running the dishwasher daily). Having the full kitchen was great. We did a bit of light shopping on our arrival day so that we could eat a few healthy breakfasts and lunches from our room. There was no charge for in room internet access and the service seemed to work well both in the room and also at the pool. They also nice gym / spa given this is a limited service location. The HGVC brand is a time share that also operates as a hotel/condo rental. Unfortunately there are virtually no HHonors Diamond benefits at this brand other than a few bonus points. (No breakfast, etc.) We knew this coming in and it was not an issue. They gave us a couple of bottles of water when we checked in (no charge) The one negative I will say is that their check out time of 10am is ridiculously early. We were only offered a noon check out as Diamond members and had to push for a later check out. They offered 2pm for $50 (crazy!) and I pushed for no charge and they finally relented after I pointed out this is to be a Diamond benefit, and if they could offer it for $50, they could offer it for free as it was not an availability issue! We were never harassed to attend a time share presentation. They asked us to stop by for a "welcome gift" which we skipped....we know that’s just wanting to talk timeshare with us....no thanks. They also left one message in our room and that was it. I understand self parking is free and valet does have a charge. We did not use the parking amenities as we returned our rental car after check in and then just took a taxi to the airport on our final day. The bell desk was excellent at both storing / delivering our luggage on check in, as well as storing our luggage/getting us a cab on check out. Besides the great rooms and non gaming property, the pool scenario was excellent!!! You have the best of both worlds. Full use of the pools at the Flamingo....a short stroll down a nice walkway and the relaxing enjoyable pool at the HGVC-F. The upstairs pool at the Flamingo is a family pool, and the large lower pool is adults only....which is great. We went over to the Flamingo pool in the mornings when they had full sun and the crowds were not too bad. Unfortunately, the pools at the Flamingo are very crowded and the drink / food is over the top expensive. Well...when you have had enough of that....wala, welcome to the private oasis of the HGVC-F pool ONLY for guests of the HGVC-F. This was a very nice, smaller pool with a great hot tub and nice loungers. You did have the full on music from the Flamingo, (which some people may not like) just across the fence, but no crowds. We were able to find loungers either in the sun or shade almost any time. They also have several cabanas and tables (no charge). The pool is really shaded in the morning, but that’s why we went over to the Flamingo Adults pool in the morning. The other cool thing about the pool is that they also allow you to bring in your own food and non alcoholic beverages. (You can bring alcohol in after the bar closes.) Note: No glass containers. They even have barbeque grills where you can grill a steak if you choose. Another great thing, the pool opens on hour before the Flamingo (8am for HGVC-F and 9am for Flamingo) and stays open several hours longer. (10pm for HGVC-F and 6pm for Flamingo) The poolside bar has excellent prices and great service on both food, and drinks (both adult and non adult beverages). Tim the bartender is excellent. If you are lucky enough to be there the days he works (usually Wednesday thru Sunday).....he will take great care of you. Food and drink prices are about half of what the prices are at the Flamingo....awesome! The food and drinks are all very good. Access to the strip is very easy....just go down the walkway to the pool (open 24 hours) and walk along side road past the Flamingo, and next to Bill's Gamblin Hall and there you are. Less than 3 minutes to the strip....This is much faster than walking through the Flamingo. We would stay here again in a heartbeat for our summer trips when we want to have the access to the pools. Winter time....it would be a toss up between this location and Planet Hollywood (so you don’t have to go outside to get to the casino.)

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: plpl
Reviews.Content: Hello Friends, I read your review about not having access to the Flamingo pool. I called the Hilton and asked if we would have access as we are going soon. They said "yes". I told them about your review and they said it was a mix up as they had a new pool manager at the Flamingo and he did not know that Hilton customers had access.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at HGVC Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: beowulf_agate
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property many times over the years and have never been disappointed. We were there for a week this time at the beginning of April and it is the first time we brought the kids (teenagers). They had a good time in the swimming pools and visiting Red Rock Canyon, Valley of Fire State Park, Ethel M cactus garden, Springs Preserve, Secret Garden at the Mirage. And the girls liked shopping at the Fashion Show Mall and the Premium Outlets. There are many family-oriented shows on the strip including some of the Cirque du Soleil shows, Nathan Burton (excellent!), and Dick Arthur. The check-in process went very smoothly. The building is very well maintained. All staff were very polite and professional during our stay. The housekeeping staff responded very quickly to our one request. The kitchen was well stocked - paper towels, dishwasher soap, laundry detergent, shampoo, and lotion were provided. The unit had a washer/dryer, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, garbage disposal, plenty of pots and pans, towels, and dish sponge. The housekeeping staff came in mid-week to re-stock the kitchen and bring in new towels and linen. We had a nice pool of the pools, and partial views of the strip (Eiffel Tower, Bellagio fountains) and a partial view of the mountains. There were two flat-screen TVs in the unit and the bed and sofabed were very comfortable. Free wi-fi was available. The pools at the Flamingo are great, having just opened for the season during our stay there. HGVC Flamingo quests were allowed to use the Flamingo pools. However, the main pool is now adult only which was a bit of a disappointment but the family-oriented Beach Club is a very nice pool. The private heated year-around HGVC pool was also very nice albeit smaller than the main Flamingo pools. There is also a nice small Fitness Center onsite. The self-park is a bit of walk (maybe 5 minutes) but it is free, had plenty of space right by the elevator, and beats paying for valet parking + tips. At the HGVC Flamingo you are very close to the strip but it is still a bit removed from the noise and activity. Swimming in the HGVC pool in the evenings was very quiet and peaceful. We really loved our stay here and will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Came for the pool was very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: opieconklin
Reviews.Content: We are here with our young teens and chose this location mainly for the apartment feel as well as the use of the Flamingo pools. Well, guess what, HG Flamingo guests no longer are allowed to use the Flamingo pools. I made sure to ask every time I called to make sure that the pools would be open when we got here. Sure, they are open, but we can't use them. We have a very nice view from the 14th floor of the lovely pool complex we came for but can't use! Would have looked elsewhere. I am so angry with them I can't even comment on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, service”
Reviews.Author: meginoregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in a one-bedroom. Our unit was at the end of the hall in the north tower, and we did not share a vestibule with a studio unit. It was very quiet and we never heard other guests in the hall, nextdoor, or above us. We had a nice view of the Flamingo pool, and could see some lights looking up the strip, but most of the strip was obscured by the Flamingo Hotel towers. As other reviews have mentioned, the location is really terrific. From the elevator in our tower (the 3 towers do not connect, except on the 1st floor) we could exit to a service road that we walked up one short block to get to Las Vegas Blvd right at Margaritaville. Or we could walk through the lobby or the pool area, and quickly get to Flamingo Blvd, and the over-street walkways to Caesar’s or Bally’s or Bellagio. Stage Door Liquor was very close, and a good place to buy bottled water and other convenience store-type items. The condo was missing some items when we arrived. There were no coffee filters, no iron or ironing board, and only one dishtowel and no dishrags. I called and someone brought up the coffee filters within about 30 minutes. The other items I noticed later, and left a note for housekeeping on the day of our mid-week maid service, and those items were left in the room for us. I would suggest checking the inventory of the room when you arrive, and requesting any items that are missing, because it’s inconvenient to wait for them when you need them. The hairdryer was really wimpy. The only other criticism I have is that to call the HGVC front desk you have to dial 0, wait for a recording to run through, press 0 again, wait for an answer, and then the Flamingo Hotel operator answers, and you have to ask to be transferred to the HGVC desk. It gets old having to go through this every time you want to ask for the valet to bring your car, or have another question or request. I don’t know why they can’t have their own phone system; it’s certainly a large enough facility to warrant that. The unit was nice, with attractive décor. There was a stacking washer/dryer in a closet, a small galley-style kitchen with stove/oven, microwave, full-sized refrigerator, and dishwasher. Dishes for four. Not a huge amount of counter space, but adequate. Living room had a sofa sleeper (double) and arm chair, coffee table and side table, and a credenza that housed a room safe, DVD player, and a good-sized flat-screen TV. The living area was completed with a built-in upholstered seating bench, a glass-topped rectangular table, and two dining chairs. The king-sized bed had nice sheets and a light-weight down comforter. Another flat-screen TV was atop a chest of drawers, and there was an upholstered chair in the bedroom. The bedroom area was open to part of the bathroom, containing the clothes closet, a sink and large countertop area, and a huge, round, jetted tub. The rest of the bathroom was a pass-through to the entry area, and had another sink and counter area, with a separate toilet and shower room, which could be closed off with a pocket door. This layout made for good traffic flow through the unit. We had a rental car, and rather than self-park (which I think involved a fairly long walk to/from the parking garage) we spent $50 for the all-week valet parking. Add to that the tips every time we took our car out, plus the cost of the car rental, and it really adds up to have a car. We mainly wanted a car so we could visit Hoover Dam and Valley of Fire, but I think for future trips we would skip the car and just walk everywhere. All of the staff were very nice and helpful. After check-in they send you to a “Welcome Desk” which is a code name for “timeshare promotion desk.” You really could skip this step, but they do give some coupons, and of course offer you free tickets to a show (but not a top-notch show) if you attend a presentation. We declined, and then got phone calls and messages daily from them.

Reviews.Title: “Central to the Vegas Strip, without the bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: sarahlynae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property while visiting Vegas for the WCC Basketball tournament in early March. We booked the 2 bedroom suite, which should be noted is a lock-out style with a foyer joining the two rooms. Each room featured a king size bed and a jacuzzi tub in each bathroom. The kitchen/living room was rather small and didn't have adequate seating for more the 3 people. The rooms were extremely tidy and nicely decorated. As the other reviews state it is a mere 2 minute walk to the strip via the Flamingo lobby. The pool area at the hotel was small yet adequate not to mention offered cheaper drink prices than the neighboring Flamingo pool (which you have access to). In general the hotel was nice and suited our needs, there is no casino floor on the premise which was a nice break from what Vegas has to offer. Would I stay here again? Probably not, only because there are so many hotels in Las Vegas and I would like to experience something different in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Service Entrance Parking”
Reviews.Author: heumanntouch
Reviews.Content: This property is very conviently located if you have no car and want to stay right in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip. With that said if you have a car and dont want to pay the $10 a day valet parking, then just know you will have to park your car in what appears to be a parking lot for the casino and service staff. This location was the first HGVC location in Las Vegas and it shows in its design and layout. When you park you have to go though a maze of elevators and buildings to get to the main buidling, then once inside you have two doors to get to your room. There is a hall way door (very heavy) and then an interior door (hall way door opens to a small entrance way where there are two doors) This is convient if you are occupying both rooms or you are crazy about securty. Once inside you again realize this was the first attempt at getting it right. I have stayed at all three of the properties in Las Vegas and this one is the least user friendly layout. Everything from the lighting to the kitchen layout to the bathroom, appears to not have thought out design wise. On a positive note, all rooms face the inter court yard area (pool) and you are only a few steps from the Flamingo Casino. The staff was nice and the busboys very helpful with getting our luggage from our car to our room and the reverse when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Looking to Win in Vegas...then start here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Antkneee
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden gem among huge casino based hotels!!! I choose this hotel when I have to travel to Vegas because the location is fantastic. The lobby of the hotel is not surrounded by slot machines. The rooms are nice and big. The fitness room is great and free (unlike the big hotels which charge you 25 bucks a day). I also got free internet last time for being a Hilton Honors Member...I also get status and points from Hilton for staying here. The Monorail to the Convention Center is outside the back door. And if I want to go to a casino, then I simply just walk into the Flamingo Hilton and I can enjoy the ding ding ding of people losing there money. There is a small kitchen and washer/dryer in some...I love being able to cook my own breakfast and wash my workout clothes. This hotel is a win-win for me in a sea of losers (that is a gamblers reference)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, yet quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: HalleGrace
Reviews.Content: Great trip! We stayed here with our friends booking two one-bedroom units and one-two bedroom unit for 3 nights. I had called prior to our stay to make early arrival reservations for one of our friends and to confirm that the 3 reservations were linked. We then received two confirmation phone calls one -verifying our arrangements and another confirming our room was ready just as we were driving into town. What a great greeting. Our guests commented on the friendly reception and greeting when they arrived. This high level of service continued through our stay. One couple became ill while we were together and we were able to make arrangements to extend their stay or provide a late check out. As we were walking away from making these arrangments, Gina at the front desk also added that they would send a Get Well basket to our friends room. Hat's off to the team at the HGVC at the Flamingo, you made this a memorable experience. One thing to take into consideration is that two-bedroom units are lock-offs. A combination of a one bedroom suite and a studio sharing a common entry door. Great with teens or friends with a different schedule, not as much flow as a two-bedroom apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, perfect place for a family to stay while in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalK
Reviews.Content: In general we love HIlton Grand Vacation properties and this was no exception. Rooms are perfect for families - full kitchen, laundry, separate bedroom, 2 sink areas in the bathroom, etc... The property is kept very nicely and we felt the staff went above and beyond. Robert, who helped us with our luggage when we arrived and then also when we left was extra friendly and helpful. Also we had a problem with our tv remote the first day and a maintenance man was at our door within 10 minutes and took care of it right away. Also we asked the housekeeper about getting some coffee filtes and she returned 10 minutes later with a whole pack. All in all a class act! Not to mention the location is very central on the strip and gambling at the Flamingo is just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Parlez vous francais...?”
Reviews.Author: Nimes011
Reviews.Content: I only ask because I could see the fake Eiffel Tower out my window. Sorry, I’m not normally a hotel snob, and the hotel itself is fine, in fact, it’s great, but I have issues with Vegas that have likely caused a bias in my score for this place. If you like Vegas, there is absolutely no reason not to stay at this hotel. I stayed here on the Fed Gov rate on business at Nellis AFB so I can’t really comment on the overall value, but it is conveniently located and is attached to the Flamingo Hotel and Casino right off of the Strip. The basic rooms are nice, clean, and the one I was in had a great view of the (fake) Eiffel Tower as well as a jacuzzi tub. Somehow, I found this mildly depressing, but this is one of my own idiosyncrasies and not an issue most will find important…at all. Overall, this is a good Vegas Hotel and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Missy993
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel and let me just say that I enjoyed every second of my stay. The thing I loved best about this place was the location. We hardly drove at all as all major attractions and events were just at our doorstep. The staff working there were wonderful and the accommodations very clean and comfortable. The Customer Service gave great personal assistance with amazing advice for sightseeing and great places to eat. I will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: derkEngland
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Vacations Club ant the Flamingo in Vegas does I'm afraid get mixed up with the Flamingo Hotel. They are totally separate and on very different levels of quality. The Vacations Club is one that can be totally recommended. We stayed there for seven days last September in a two bedroom suite. everything is supplied including full kitchen, dishwasher , washing machine and dryer. Both bedrooms had spa baths. The pool is rather on the small size, however it is heated. There are BBQ's around the pool for residents to use if required, we never had a problem in securing one. If you need a larger pool you are able to use the main Flamingo pools, but they are rather noisy and busy in the peak times . The is a small shop/deli which also hosts a good range of Starbucks plus a small gym. The staff are very helpful once you get over the initial three minutes of trying to get you to attend a presentation, just say no and they never mention it again. A real class act even by Hilton VC standards, have already booked for a ten day stay for September 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: linda077
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a timeshare exchange and chose it for it's position on the strip. We have previously stayed at the newer HGVC near Circus Circus which was great but too far to walk to any other hotels. This location was perfect. Just behind the Flamingo Hotel centre strip. We were allocated a 2 bed suite on the 10th Floor. From the lounge we had a view of the Flamingo pool and could see the Bellagio Fountains!! The room was huge, very well kept and extremely clean - no complaints at all. Full kitchen with everything we needed. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. There is a nice deli in the property but there is also a small supermarket a minutes walk away which has cheaper products. To get to the strip it is just a stroll through the Flamingo hotel approx 2 mins. You don't need a car to stop here unless you want to travel further afield - we hired a car from reception for a couple of days which was very convenient. The porters will get you a taxi within minutes. Top tip for eating out - the Buffet at the Belagio - we had lunch there for $19.99 which included unlimited food and soft drinks. The food was top quality with a huge variety. The Cheesecake Factory in the Forum is also a favourite. Husband played floodlight golf at the Calloway Centre at the end of the strip and throughly recommended it. Very reasonable cost including club hire and buggy and two beers!! Very well kept course. All in all a great place to stop centre strip - cant recommend higly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little gem.”
Reviews.Author: cjh46
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in August - a one bedroom suite. This is a nice little oasis in busy Las Vegas - tucked away behind the Flamingo. Hundreds of people were jammed around the pool at the Flamingo every day. The pool area at HGVC-Flamingo is almost like a private facility - tranquil and uncrowded. Staff are professional and helpful. The suite was excellent - no problems or disappointments with anything. A great location in the center of the Strip. The monorail station is next door. A Hertz car rental is in the nearby Flamingo. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: For the most part, its just an average place to stay. The rooms are spacious but nothing special, except for the jacuzzi tub - it was the best part - lots of jets and open to the living room so you could soak and watch tv. Some of the pipes squealed when someone else in a neighboring room would shower - this was annoying my first night, but the other nights, they apparently weren't taking late night showers! And my shower leaked quite a bit on the floor. Floors do seem a little thin - I could hear the room above me walking, but it wasn't an issue late at night. The gym is a little old - the ellipticals were newer, but treadmills and bike were tired. They do have some weight machines. Its right next to the flamingo, which leaves a lot to be desired in terms of restaurants and it only has a small cafe/market on site, so do your eating before you get back to the hotel. Front desk staff weren't too friendly, but valet and housekeeping were extremely nice. Happily, I was NOT approached about their time shares. So, if you like your hilton points like I do, its not a bad choice on the strip. but in the future, i will probably look for a nicer room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: zeacie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with young family in a 2 bedroom suite. Rooms were great, kids had their own room with tv, kitchenette, spa bath and bathroom. Our room had a huge jacuzzi tub, separate shower and toilet, full kitchen, washer/dryer, dining and lounge area. Rooms all overlook Flamingo pool and we had glimpses of the Bellagio fountains. Had the obligatory timeshare invite when we booked in but we politely declined and it was never pushed on us again. All staff were helpful, housekeeping was excellent. Didn't use either of the pools and there is a little store near the foyer that has some basic deli items and frozen meals etc. Only complaint was a party on one of the nights at the Flamingo pool (which they did warn us about) the music was VERY loud, had to use earplugs which did drown it a bit. Other than that I would recommend this hotel for families who want to be close to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would stay again, great property”
Reviews.Author: nyebaby
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights in late october, just got back. Hotel is located behind Flamingo, a really short walk to Flamingo and/or monorail. Convenient location, best on strip, directly across from Ceasars, Bell, next to Paris. There was a Jimmy Buffett Concert nite we arrived; if you've never experienced "parrotheads" they are a trip. Hysterical outfits... My SO is a quasi-one. We did not go to concert but lotta fun people-watching... Ok booked thru AAA, upgraded prior to arrival to one bedroom suite. Worth the extra $25 per night. Beautiful, BIG. All rooms face pool & jacuzzi. Jacuzzi tub in room, full kitchen. Gas grills if u wanna bbq. We ate out mostly but had breakfast and leftovers in room. Stopped at von's on way from airport for misc items to put in fridge. Room was ready (requestd early checkin and we were 3 hrs late from EWR -- what else is new...). Front desk very very courteous and responsive. Conceirge eh,thought the guy was kinda jerky. We skipped the welcome package and timeshare show, hadn't signed up for it and there is NO pressure, they only leave a message on the phone. Wish I could afford it, I'd buy a hilton property, really pretty. Grounds and room immaculate. Housekeeping service daily. Deli open 6 am to 11 pm, had alot of stuff in there including frozen pizzas... :) Terrific property for anyone that doesnt mind not having a casino at the bottom of their elevator. Oh yea, pool was really nice, small and next door still have complimentary use of the Flamingo pool, pool bar & music. Depends on what you're into that day. During season Hilton also has an outside pool bar/restaurant but closed mid october. We didnt need it, the deli is right there if u want something. Loved the property, would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Brett M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Grand Vacations for 5 nights while on holidays, we booked the 2 bedroom spa suite, WOW if I was going to build myself a small penthouse then this would be it. Our 3 teenage children had one side with their own entry, and we had the other side with seperate bedroom huge hot tub and full size kitchen. I cant believe the room we got for the price, You also get use of one of the best pools on the strip at the Flamingo which is right next door (I think they must chill the water, boy was it cold!!)I has a small shop in the lobby which is handy for small items Free car parking also. When we go back to Vegas I dont think we would stay anywhere else, absolutely devine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: love4tcb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, comfortable room. Wonderful, caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very hot - but lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: prosperitylove79
Reviews.Content: I am a HGVC owner and the suites were great! They have a store on site (which is a little pricy, but convenient). The pool and hot tubs are clean and available every day. Every time I turned around someone was asking me if they could help me. In addition, we got in late because we flew through Chicago and the President had landed which stopped all flights from departing. We arrived a day late and I called to let Hilton know - they just asked how they could help!! The rooms were very spacious and I really enjoyed the oversized jacuzzi tub. I also found the detached bathroom and makeup area very nice so someone could be in the shower while, just outside the bathroom was a mirror and a light so someone else could be getting ready! Also Internet is free - so bring you laptop. It costs $ to use the computers in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Outlet2010
Reviews.Content: This resort is a beautiful location with wonderful suites. Excellent staff. At check in Ricardo was so helpful with our view room request. All staff responded excellent to any needs and requests with great security around the whole resort. We has a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Haven”
Reviews.Author: BillyElliot1
Reviews.Content: Our 1st stay at LasVegas! We did an RCI exchange, for 1 week , but added on 1 extra night through rental. The 1 bedroom we had was very well equipped. We had a huge jaccuzi bath in the bedroom as well as a separate shower room. Maid service was only once during our stay, but we were told we could ask for towels and toiletries if we needed more. All staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is behind Flamingo, which you have to walk through, which is very busy and noisy. I was so glad we didn't have. a casino in GVC. The pool was nice and the pool bar lady was lovely. You could order snacks which were. very good. There is a small shop, which stocks milk etc, they do nice take away salads, fruit and sandwiches. We did do a tour of Hilton and they were not pushy at all. We received tickets for Vegas the show which was fantastic! You could charge things to your room, to save carrying money. The gym looked good, but didn't use. Check out was quick and we could use the gym showers and lockers for our later departure. One down side was I would have liked a bar inside as the pool bar closed at 6pm. All in all we had a quite location right in the middle of the strip, couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alshepuk
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas. We stayed on a RCI exchange. We had a one bedroom apartemnt which was stunning. the bed was huge and so comfortable. Check in staff were great. All other staff we met including cleaners were really nice. The pool lost the sun around 5pm which was disappointing as we were out for most of the day sightseeing. The odd occasion when we did get back early we struggled to find a sunbed. As towels were free issue you could not tell what beds were free. At the weekend there was a lot of noise from the adjecent Flamingo Hotel pool.which did not botherus but it did a few other people. We loved it here and are thinking about purchasing a Hilton Week so we can come back

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabgab13
Reviews.Content: I was here with my family, but I was here to go to a conference for work. So it was a combination of work and play. We had three adults staying in one room. The check in was really fast, at 4pm. We were Hilton members but there was no line and super friendly. Room: You had to go through two doors to get to you room, at first this was weird but we quickly realized this made it so we heard no nosy from the hallways. Which was great. The room at has a great little kitchenette. It had everything we needed which was a coffee maker and refrigerator to store snacks and leftovers. The bathroom had all nice features that you excepted and a jetted tub. The weird part was there was no separation from tub and room. So that meant nobody could use it on our trip. If they fixed that it would be great. The bed was super comfortable but the pull out couch bed was one of the worst I have ever been on and I have been on a few. The tv was a nice flat screen and you could play dvds which was a plus. Lots of storage and space in the room and it looked out over the pool. The room was super quite which was the best part of it after all the noise on the Strip. Over all the room was great, but would love them to fix the couch and have some privacy for the tub. Security: I felt very safe here as a woman. They had card to get into the elevator and they always had someone at the front desk. Pool: They had a great small pool with the great high quality lounge chairs. The pool bar and grill had everything you needed and the lady who was there was very friendly. Location: It is the center of the strip but behind the Flamingo so it is quite but in the action at the same time. Also it is very close to the monorail which turned out perfect to heading to the conference area. We actually had to walk less then the other people staying at the hotels next the the conference area. It was right next to a little store that you could get alcohol and food. Internet: They do have wireless which a lot of Las Vegas Hotels do not have or you have to pay for, but it is slow. It is fast though if you use it in lobby which is quite and comfortable so that is what I did when I needed to work. Extra: The best part of the hotel was you get to be at a smaller, quite hotel, but had access to all the amenities of the Flamingo hotel. It is like getting your cake and eating it too. You did not have to walk through the smoke filled casino to get to your room, but you could use all of Flamingo hotel like you were staying at it, including the Flamingo pool which seems to be the best on the strip. Also we had dinner at the buffet in the Flamingo and I was surprised how good it was. It has lots of variety and I loved there dumplings. We had a great view too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly quiet oasis in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: tubby75
Reviews.Content: After a 11 hour flight and car rental pick up we eventually found the hotel, its not clearly visible like the bigger hotels on the strip. it's tucked behind The Flamingo. We were greeted by friendly valet staff who offered help with our bags and introduced themselves. At check in we were helped by Ricardo and another young lady (very pretty dark curly hair) they offered us ice cold water which was lovely, generally asked where we were from etc, sorted our room they didn't have a high room available at the time (i like a view) but they assured us that on would be ready within an hour. i can't praise the customer service enough with this hotel. When we got to the room we were very impressed, separate bedroom, whirlpool bath, roomy shower and fully equipped kitchen we don't cook on holiday but having the fridge and bits was so handy. The room was spotless and trust me i'm a clean and neat freak. It met all my fussy standards. The pool area is so nice. The staff at the bar called us by our names and were very helpful with iced water etc. There was always plenty of lounges and the towels were soft and clean. Staying at this hotel you have access to the Flamingo Pool, we are only in our thirtes but we found it very busy and over crowded and were more than happy to relax in the hilton pool. There is music played in the flamingo pool and yes you can hear it but i kinda liked it. The small deli in the hotel was great again staff very friendly, excellent breakfast snacks and coffee, and they also do light salads which were yummy. Made a change from the excess buffets that were about. We used valet and it was always quick and prompt you could ring down from your room, this way your car is cooling with the A/C when you get down. This is a timeshare condo hotel but we never got the chat 'would we be interested' there was a message left on the phone, we didn't reply and no more was mentioned. I got a weeks stay here through the disney vacation club but we met other british folk in the hotel who simply just booked through the website. I really can't stress enough how great this hotel is. We visited all the 'brand' hotels on the strip and i can honestly say that i would rather stay here. Vegas is all about excess and the other hotels seem overcrowded with tourists and i loved that although i could enjoy all the casinos and bars in the other hotels then i could escape at the end of the evening to the hilton. I don't think the bellagio front desk would say good morning to you personally by your name each morning. If you want to enjoy all what Las Vegas has to offer but would also like abit of down time this is the place for you. I have said to so many of my friends that it was fantastic. I just can't wait to return... :D

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Ctguide
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip and yet have a room with peace and quiet, this is it. Located behind the Flamingo Hotel - mid strip - this hotel (and timeshare) has a staff that is most professional and friendly. All areas were spotless, the unit we had (facing the pool area as are all units) was clean and comfortable (and quiet). Because of the location you can walk to most all other hotels and resorts on the strip. The exceptiion is downtown but the monorail has a station right there or the bus stops out front of the Flamingo. If you do have a car the hotel provides free parking in a garage next door. We usually rent a car as we do like to travel to some of the Stations Casinos and this time also went to Zion National Park and Arizona. Really easy to drive in Las Vegas. We would definitly stay here again because of the location and great room units. (plus the very nice pool. You can use the Flamingo pool for free, its huge but crowded)

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of high TA rating”
Reviews.Author: przyk
Reviews.Content: I booked this room months ago and have been reading the TA reviews ever since. I still had a lot of unanswered questions, so I am mainly going to answer the questions I had hoping the information will be of value to others too. This is a very nice property and well deserving of the high TA rating. This was the first time I stayed at a non casino hotel in Vegas. I never saw more than one or two people waiting at the front desk, which is totally different than the check in experience at many casino hotels. Also different is after we finished checking in we were sent to talk to the welcome lady, who is just trying to get people to commit to listening to the time share presentation. When I run into those people on the street I am very short. Because I was checking into the hotel I was trying to be polite, but after about the 3rd time she asked me why I wouldn't waste a morning listening to a high pressure sales pitch I lost my patience. So you might as well be rude right off the bat and save yourself some time. You won't get away from her any other way. If you book thru a time share you are an "owner" and if you book thru Hilton you are a "renter". The reviews on this forum lead me to believe there would not be daily maid service, which is true if you are a time share owner. But, because we booked thru Hilton and were renters we did have daily maid service and coffee packs were replenished daily. I had already checked in the deli and they were charging $2.29 for one coffee pack, so I am glad it was included in my room rate. The deli kind of ticked me off in that prices were not listed on most items. I asked about a 6 pack of bottled water and it was $ 7.50, no thank you. Some of the food was reasonably priced though, with muffins at $2.09 and breakfast sandwiches at about $3.29. If you have a car go to Von's or Albertson's for water, soda and snacks. We had a studio suite, which was spacious enough, but the kitchenette was crammed in a very small area with little counter space. The only sitting area was across the suite, not next to the kitchen area. We heard no noise except when people came out of the adjoining room. The doors slam very loud. I believe all suites face the Flamingo pool. There are only rooms on one side of the hallway. When you walk down the hallway you look out windows on one side and the rooms are all on the other side. There are three towers connected only at the ground floor. The check in desk and deli are in the center of the largest tower, which is the west tower. The HGV pool entrance and self parking garage are closer to the north tower. The Flamingo self park garage is across from the south tower. Valet parking is $10.00 per day. If you self park you can use the HGV reserved lot, which is across the street and down a short way from the north tower. It has an elevator. You can also park in the Flamingo self parking garage, which we did a few nights. I think it is more convenient, but there are only stairs near the exit across from the south tower. To use an elevator in the Flamingo lot you would have to go to the far end of the parking garage, away from the HGV. I parked on the 3rd floor near the HGV and walked down. The entrance to either garage is off Audrie Lane or Winnick Av. If you are driving and unfamiliar with the area I highly recommend you look at google street view to get your bearings. Winnick Ave runs directly under the monorail track, so that is a good landmark to use. Many of the reviews on this forum are written by travelers who came with children, so I was a little concerned about noise, etc., but we were not bothered at all. The walk to the Flamingo and on to the Strip was pleasant. You walk along the fence by the Flamingo pool for just 2 or 3 minutes and you are at the casino. It was dark at night, but there are security guards and cameras around. We even ran into a couple of guards on bikes riding thru the HGV parking garage one night. This is a great center Strip location. A car is convenient to get groceries and we wanted it to get to the Wisconsin/UNLV football game, but this is a great location if you won't have a car. I am on Trip Advisor all the time and would be happy to answer questions about the HGV.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious, and a nice kitchen”
Reviews.Author: BowlingGrandma2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite with 2 children, ages 3 and 10 years. The kitchen was very handy to save some money on meals. The bathroom could be reached from either the bedroom or the main room. there is also a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. The decor is modern and comfortable. There is a store/deli in the building which was handy for snacks. You can also use the Flamingo pool when you stay here. You need your room key to enter the building and also to use the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MandyJ4
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel...perfect location....beautiful pool & wildlife area

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, very disappointed. First HGV stay.”
Reviews.Author: FordTraveller
Reviews.Content: As I read the reviews for this hotel, I was surprised to see the last review written in Jan2010. It is Aug2010. I purchased my HGV membership in the spring of this year, and I was very taken with the HGV properties as presented during my sale. I was told, that HGV maintains ALL properties to the SAME standards and I was told, YES that there is housekeeping services. I am a Diamond member at Hilton and I get the best benefits when I stay at a Hilton. First, HGV at Flamingo was way below par of what was presented to me at the sale. And, no there is NO daily housekeeping as I was only in LV for 3 days. I stayed at a 1bedroom suite. Room was not cool enough, and there is no other control to the thermostat other than :Cool, Medium, Hot and Fan on/off. Hallways in the building are very very hot, no air conditioning. I am very disappointed. I wished that I had not bought the Hilton timeshare, to be honest. I am better served by paying the discounted price offered to the general public (and not have to be burdened with ownership costs and maintenance fees). Too bad maintenance fees do not cover maintenance in rooms during stay. At least if I paid the hotel bill, that I would get maid service, turn down service etc.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas is a family friendly destination as is HGVC-Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: keybjones
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I flew to Vegas for two nights: Wed and Thurs. Spent $23 inc $3 tip on the taxi to HGVC. Checked in at 4:45 and it was quick and painless. Had a nice 1 bedroom suite overlooking the pool. No noise issues at all. We all really liked the room, both the King bed and sofa bed were comfy. LOVED the two person jet tub!!!! Nice touch to supply starbucks coffee packets for the coffee maker. Right after check in we walked down to the Venitian (took 30 min due to lots of ped traffic). Got our tickets for 7:00 show for the Blue Man Group. As an FYI, we bought those tickects on our Alligant Airways Flight. Only paid $69 each for the "good seats" but we were actually seated in the "great seats" and got to meet the guys after the show, with only 5 other people. It was a great show and very family friendly. While at the Venitian, we ate at the Grand Lux Cafe (very good and reasonably priced) and we did a gondala ride (so so experience for the price). Had breakfast sandwiches and bagels from the on HGVC site cafe our first morning. Ok prices and tasted pretty good. There is a small store right next to the hotel that has better prices. For reasonable prices,drive or take a taxi to Albertsons or Safeway which are both nearby but off the strip. We heard from several people that Batistas, the Italian resturant right next door is very good and reasonably priced although we didn't try it. The vallet guys were very nice and good at getting us taxi's quickly. Thursday we saw Cirque du Solei KA at MGM (got discounted tickets on Ebay). Excellent show,highly recommend but probably not good for kids 10 and under as there is a plot to follow. Ate at Rainforest Cafe at MGM. Good food and fun atmosphere. Friday we ate at Hash House A-go-go at Imperial Palace. VERY good food and great prices, close to HGVC. Also did the Effiel Tower. Enjoyable but would recommend nightime experience for prettier views. Budget for taxi's (bwt $8-12 to almost anywhere on the strip) and save yourself the hassle of getting out to the strip and avoid the heat! Taxi back to airport was $9. We had a very fun trip and really enjoyed HGVC-Flamingo's ammenities and location. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: travlinfamilyof6
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice as the front and back end of a ten day trip. Staff was great, and facility is exceptionally convenient for being just off the strip. Rooms are large with adjoining suites given our large size (6). Made the mistake of first going to the much larger pool at the Flamingo, and my 11 year old quickly pointed out that this was not an appropriate environment for families. Indeed; loud, crowded and expensive. At the Hilton "quiet" pool, the drinks and food were half the price and the pool much more suitable for anyone less than 15 or over 40. Would definitely stay at this place again if we take the family back to Vegas. Also would point out that parking was easy, and the ease of driving to and from the airport on surface streets could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: irishguy56208
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a friend's wedding in Vegas and state here. I am very easy to please, but this was a aterrible place. Here is what happened: 1. When i checked in there was no soap. I had to call three times and it took nearly three hours to get them some soap and shampoo. 2. My second night I did not get any maid service at all and needed towels to get ready for the wedding. It took three calls and three hours to get towels (But not before I had to leave) and the "guest service" rep yelled at me over the phone. (I was not one time rude until I was desperate for towels.) 3. Worst of all someone in the hall way had vomited and left the sheets out side the room which house keeping left out ALL day. The smell was nauseating. The carper was filthy. The place was a dump and not clean at all. Trust me I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: DKKT
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice, clean, big rooms, extras provided (i.e. paper towels, sponge, etc), attached to the Flamingo (gambling, restaurants, pools, etc), short walk to Strip through Flamingo, across from Caesar's, short walk to monorail (5 mins), free parking. Great for families. Cons: Flamingo is somewhat "old" and not as nice as the upscale hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hotel without the Casino"”
Reviews.Author: DBLDtop
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice rooms. We traveled with 3 kids, my youngest is 5 and he slept on the sofa pillows on the floor. We really appreciated the close proximity to the Flamingo pool. I used Priceline and the front desk was able to beat the rate, but priceline wouldn't match the price since it was 48 hours past my transaction date. But otherwise we recommend and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Frandis
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Suites live up to the name, we had a 1 bed apartment on the 7th floor. Excellent accommodation recently updated I think, very well equipped and furnished 2 large LCD flat screen TV's, DVD, in room safe, and a full kitchen - not that I did any cooking - with washer/dryer, dishwasher etc. Very hand for lunch, breakfast, take away etc. as Vegas can be very expensive eating out all the time. Very comfy bed, large whirlpool bath ensuite to bedroom with a separate section with shower and toilet accessible from both bedroom and living room, ideal if you had other guests sleeping on the sofa bed. Very quiet location for sleeping, yet only 2 minutes from the strip oposite Ceasars Palace and Belagio, lovely pool and direct access to Flamingo hotel, pool and gardens, free parking and wi-fi but it was slow at times. Small deli with take away food a bit pricey but handy. There was a larger supermarket which was cheaper on entrance road to resort on corner facing Ballys side entrance. Staff very friendly and helpful and they even left us balloons and a card signed by them all wishing us a happy 20th wedding anniversary, a really nice touch. We would definately stay again, best place we ever stayed in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: momsrule
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my 80 year old mother here for a vacation treat. We stayed in a two bedroom unit and had a GREAT time!! The unit was ideal, it was a single entrance and then split off into two seperate units - my mother was in the smaller lock off and we had the master unit. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the locations was THE BEST!! All of the employees that we encountered were super friendly and accomodating. My husband used the self parking (I highly recommend getting a rental car) and once he figured out where the reserved parking was, it worked out very well. The hotel has a great pool area. You are free to use the Flamingo, but we stayed at the smaller pool because the casino one was super crowded. The one warm afternoon we were poolside, the attendants came by with popsicles for everyone - how "cool" was that?! The proximity to the other casinos was great at this location. Next time we timeshare back to Vegas, I would choose this location in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Good family choice.”
Reviews.Author: marlboro1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom unit with our 2 sons, 22 & 25. It served the purpose perfectly in that we had nice sized rooms with a central living room/kitchen/dining area in which to gather. Saved money by having breakfast in the unit each day. The cost was less than 2 rooms at any decent strip hotel, so the communal rooms were a bonus. On site deli was convenient and has a fairly large assortment of items and prices just slightly higher than off-site. We used the Flamingo pool (there is now a fence around it, so you have to go around and enter thru an admissions gate) only one day... the thumping music was too much to tolerate. We heard the "music" thumping from the pool beginning 10am each day, thru 6pm, altho we were on the 9th floor. Didn't really interfere with us, but if you have a young child or plan on a midday nap, be prepared. The HGVC pool was actually quite nice, and the bar service personnel very pleasant and efficient. The hotel is both convenient, and not.... the location is central strip right on the monorail loop... but, you have to walk thru the Flamingo to get to both. It is a good 10 min walk to get out to the strip, where everything looks close, but isn't. Overall, though, we were very satisfied with our experience there, and thought it was a much better choice than taking 2 hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “View from a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: Affe
Reviews.Content: This review is based on wheelchair accessibility (except rating). LOCATION We stayed at this property on July 2009 - at that time you could reach the Flamingo via the swimming pool, so it was not very far. BTW, it is not on the Strip so consider some walking. COMMON AREAS All areas are accessible, sometimes with ramps. ROOM (non-handicap room no. 1615) We had booked a handicap room, which was not available on our arrival, so we stayed in a regular room.
