Most of the room is carpeted. Using the whirlpool bathtub is challenging since it is a deep-soak bathtub (I am not posting pictures since there are many already). The shower has a step and walls, so we could not use it. STAFF HELPFULNESS Average. A handicap room was not available, but they offered us free valet parking. GENERAL RATING (not related to accessibility) Great rooms, quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke Free”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: We had never visited Las Vegas before but heard from friends that the hotels and casinos were filled with cigarette smoke so we decided to stay at a smoke free hotel. The location was great - right behind the Flamingo Hotel and we could easily walk to a number of other hotels and casinos. The one bedroom suite contained a full kitchen and even had a washer and dryer. Guests could use the Flamingo pool which is one of the best in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed not what you see on their website!”
Reviews.Author: smallgroupsonly
Reviews.Content: OK accomodations if you want to keep your distance from the Vegas Strip. Quiet and clean. Apparently the fencing off of the pool area from access to the Flaimingo Hotel happened in March 2010 and their website has not updated this information. To get to the strip you must walk around the fences for the Flamingo Hotel pool area. Would not recommend this site if someone likes to stay later in the evening in the casinos and would have to then make this walk alone with no visibkle security until you arrive back inside the lobby of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff made the difference!”
Reviews.Author: HappinessZanesville
Reviews.Content: Very nice/clean place. The security is awesome. The general manager actually brought coffee to me while I was in the hottub one morning. He sat and chatted with me for a couple of minutes. Only thing disappointing was I am a diamond VIP and there was no breakfast or upgrade. Other than that I would stay again and again! Thanks HGV at the Flamingo!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: yukondoit
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here. I borrowed my father's timeshare week. It's further up the Strip than where I usually stay (somewhere near MGM Grand) -- but we found the location to be prime for venturing up toward the Fashion Show Mall, the Wynn, and further than I'd be able to comfortably get from the MGM. Realize the Strip is extremely long, there is a lot of walking, but with Caesar's right across the street, you really can't go wrong here. The service was incredible. From the front desk, to housekeeping, to the bellmen and everyone else, we were always greeted, smiled at, everything was impeccably clean. Our room was beautiful; a one-bedroom in the North Tower with a huge jacuzzi tub, beautiful bathroom, living area and kitchen. My only two gripes about the room were that (1) housekeeping apparently only comes once per week, which I find to be too little -- we arrived on Saturday and they cleaned on Tuesday, which left us with a mess from Tuesday on; (2) the shower water was seldom hot enough. In any event, we had a washer-dryer, a fully equipped kitchen, our room was immaculate and even I, a germophobe, was happy sleeping in the bed, in the sheets, walking barefoot in the room. The hotel has a cute little cafe, and they have amazing coffee if you like it strong. The patio area is great, the pool is cute and they have quite a few amenities. You do have to carry your key around all the time to get into the building, to use the elevator, etc; I had never seen that before, or noticed it, but apparently it is the status quo for timeshare properties. I'd be very happy to go back here, to be honest. This is a beautiful hotel, and the staff made a huge difference. It's too bad it's tied to the Flamingo, which I found to be the trashiest, dirtiest and least desirable location on the entire Strip. Rest assured, coming from someone who is almost never completely satisfied with hotels, this was a fantastic choice; it's quiet and peaceful and allows for a break from the insanity of the Strip and casinos. You can't beat their free parking, either.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, yet close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersFour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGV-Flamingo for a week in April. It was our after taxes get-away. We enjoyed our week and it was everything we had hoped it would be. Quiet! Close to the Strip. The staff were all very accommodating and friendly. Wish we could exchange into here again sooner than once every four years!!!

Reviews.Title: “the flamingo”
Reviews.Author: TraceyC5
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at the flamingo. they had anything you needed there. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Time at the Hilton Grand!”
Reviews.Author: LakeWashburn
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the HGVC Flamingo. The location could not be more convenient. We would cut through the Flamingo Hotel to get out to the strip. The best part was if we wanted to get away from the hussle and bussle that you felt that you were in a tropical paradise with the lush grounds. We were told that we still had access to use the Flamingo Hotel pools even though it is no longer a Hilton. The property is very clean and kept up. The rooms have been updated. There is a small coffee shop on the premises. We rented a car and opted to use the parking ramp versus valet. The ramp is located just a few step away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sammyjb19
Reviews.Content: The rooms are wonderful. The front desk staff is very nice and helpful. They gave us exactly what we had requested, a non-smoking room on a high floor (14th floor). The concierge is not helpful and was rude at times. Our experience overall was that with some staff we were not treated as well as older couples and families we saw on the property, which was a bit upsetting considering I am a Silver VIP both with Hilton and another large hotel chain. Other than that one complaint the stay was great. In our opinion it is one of the best places to stay on the strip. It is like home away from home and again the front desk staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC is not the Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: Bett19
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation Club at the Flamingo is a seperate hotel behind the Flamingo. A number of the reviews are confusing the two properties. There are no buffets or casino at HGVC. The Flamingo is no longer a Hilton and is part of Harrahs. The hotel offers studio and one and two bedroom suites. All have kitchens which allows one to have breakfast in their room, unlike the hotels on the strip that don't even provide coffee pots. The rooms face the beautiful pools and gardens of the Flamingo Hotel. It also has its own private heated pool area. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Rooms are quiet, elevators efficient. The location is excellent with easy walking access to the strip. We booked through Hilton Honors, although most guess are there as timeshare owners.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: GT6
Reviews.Content: I just stayed a couple of nights with a colleague while in town on business. The location couldn't have been better. It is right behind the Flamingo (quiet night sleep), but very close to everything. It is less than a 2 minute walk to the Flamingo and a very short walk to Ceasars and Bally's. The hotel was in pretty good shape. My room was updated nicely as well. Remember, this is a hotel, not a casino......although for the most part connected to the Flamingo. Really, my only real complaint is that there is no real restaurant. although they do have a convenience type of store that does serve sandwiches. But, who really wants a sandwich in Vegas? With the location, price, and service I will be staying here again the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Conference at the Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: RonaldG4
Reviews.Content: I attended a Code conference there. The Hotel rooms were average and the Casino was great. It is located in the heart of the Las vegas strip near Ceasars, Bally's and the Casino Royale. It was within walking distance to most of the Las Vegas Strip. The hotel rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: DawnM4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Clean, close to all, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location convenient to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Alaxsxaq
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention at Caesar's. The hotel was quiet and clean and conveniently located. There is a monorail stop right in front of the hotel and the strip is a short, albeit somewhat convoluted walk through the Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tonilGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually a time share resort, however it is excellent. We had a jacuzzi in our suite and the place could not be faulted. The kitchen area has all the utensils you are likely to require and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The only criticism I would make is that the pool is very small,but we were informed that we were allowed to use the Flamingo pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas stay!”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my parents, stayed at the HGVC at the Flamingo for 4 nights in a 2 bedroom suite. This was our first time at this south mid-strip location, which was fabulous! (Getting into the actual building was confusing, as the HGVC was back-to-back to the Flamingo. Don't try to walk through the Flamingo to get to the HGVC at night. Just don't do it. The best is to just walk all the way down the street between the Flamingo and O'Sheas. Be careful as there is not always a sidewalk down this street.) There was free parking in the Flamingo parking deck. Check in was easy. (I won't repeat what the other reviewers mentioned about the amenities.) It's the little things that made our stay. We checked in on my husband's birthday. That evening, we were brought a staff signed card and a little snack gift with three balloons festively tied to it. It was a very sweet gesture and it made my husband's day! We also liked the layout of the suite. Past the main door of the suite led to a little foyer with two doors, one leading to a studio bedroom, one leading to the one bedroom suite. This is different from other HGVC muliple bedroom suites in that it provided a little more privacy. Because my parents had different plans in Vegas than my husband and I, we were able to come and go without waking the other couple (as my parents were early risers and we were the late-nighters!) Kitchen was invaluable for making egg breakfasts. Although we had a car from the first leg of our vacation, we left it parked in the deck and seldom used it. Most of the casinos we wanted to go to was easily reached within walking distance. We are HGVC owners on the property on the strip, and while that facility is new and beautiful, should we find vacancy at this location, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here for the better location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Legs, Shame about the Face!”
Reviews.Author: RabidTraveller4
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, middle of the strip, right behind the Flamingo Casino and Hotel. Had a one bedroom villa on a RCI Exchange, and was looking for a restful stay. The kitchen area was very nice, but the light switches made no sense at all, in most cases you had to walk through a dark room to turn on a light! The bedroom was shared by a partial bathroom with a soaking tub. Okay for folks that want to soak and then run to bed, but I prefer seperate rooms for bathing. The sleeper sofa was hard as a boulder, and just about as comfortable. But I did enjoy the breakfast nook treatment for dining. To get anywhere within the resort you had to walk out through the pool area of the Flamingo, but the garden areas with wild life was fun. My major complaint came on the afternoon before my early moring departure. The Flamingo Hotel and Casino was having a private "Pool Party", and the management of the Grand Vacations Club informed everyone that there might be some noise. At 4:20PM the sound checks started. My room was shaking from the vibrations. Really. I felt the windows and walls, and could feel the movement. I decided it was not going to get any better so walked down to talk to the folks at the front desk. They said there was nothing they could do, and the music would probably stop around midnight. I asked to speak to a manager, and the assistant manager came out and was sympathetic to my objections. But there was nothing to be done, this happens every now and then, and they have no say over the noise. I could not even watch television because I could not hear it over the non-stop band outside. I had to get up at 4:00AM, and by midnight I was exhausted and upset. Earplugs, pillows over the head, nothing worked. I finally dragged sofa cushions onto the floor in the hallway, directly under the air conditioning vent to try to block out the pounding so I could sleep. Around 2:00AM the music stopped, and I could return to the bed for a few hours nap. A week ruined by a hideous night; I'm still upset.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: savi2
Reviews.Content: Service: perfect.! Very nice, wonderful and helpful service. They tell you all the informations if you asked plus with a complimentary chocolate. Efficient check in and out. They treat you very warm and luxurious. Rooms: great. I really like the lotion. Decoration is very beautiful and well built. All excellent equipments. Bed is comfortable, lots of pillow and the jacuzzi is excellent! Facillities: as called flamingo. There're the real ones so there's the animal park, the night shows and the casino. All are great. The hotel shop sells the pink flamingo too. A sky train passby so comfortable to get around and good for sight seeing. I will surely return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: reneOntario
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms in Vegas to celebrate our 50th wedding anniverary. On checking in we found the rooms to be totally lacking in decor, cleanliness and location. We requested a change and this was granted. However, imagine our disappointment when we find that the new rooms are also lacking in decor, cleanliness and location . Whoever was responsible for wasting our time and energy for this change should be forced to take a few more courses in customer relations. We would never book at the Flamingo again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend !”
Reviews.Author: Shaz_2206
Reviews.Content: We would definitely come back to stay here, the service was great, location was excellent. My partner, myself and another friend stayed here, we booked 2 go rooms and asked for the rooms to be as close together as possible. The rooms ended up being right next to each other. Rooms were great, location was fantastic! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MDavisTucson_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HGVC the weekend of September 12/13, 2009. We chose this hotel base on other travelers opinions and we wanted to be in a hotel that did not have the noise and foot traffic of a casino hotel. This was a perfect fit for our needs. We booked a suite since it was just a short stay. The room was very clean and comfortable, overlooking the pool. I liked that the Hilton pool was much smaller and quieter than the Flamingo. Although there was no music at our pool, they cranked up the volume so high at the Flamingo pool that there was no problem hearing it. We never had a problem finding lounges at the pool, in fact, each day we were able to get a cabanna, since we prefer the shade. The pool bar service is friendy and relatively inexpensive. The deli carries almost everything you need for a short stay and the kitchenette in the studio is sufficient for 2 days. If you are staying for a week, I would recommend a 1 BR with a full kitchen so you would have more room and cooking options. The bathroom was updated, nice jetted tub and a separate toilet/shower room. Bed was comfortable as were the pillows. Hotel staff was vey helpful and friendly. I used the treadmill in the fitness center on Sunday. The fitness center is very clean, it has all the basic things you need/want for your workout while on the road. Towels and water are provided also. There is another small spa inside next to the fitnss center as well as a sauna. There is no charge to use any of these facilities. There were a few shortcomings; 1) there was no dish washing soap in the kitchen. I don't mind doing my own dishes, but I don't want to spend the money in the deli for a large dish detergent that I won't use but a few drops and is too large to carry-on in my suitcase. 2) is that there was no make-up mirror in the bathroom. 3) As someone else on this site mentioned, the room has a main door and then 2 doors off the small foyer. The main door is very heavy and "loud" when it closes. Fortunately, there was no one in the room next to us, or I'm sure they would have been really irritated at our coming and going. These are minor things, just a bit irritating, but nothing to detract from my recommendation to family/friends or to keep me from returning. If you like being close to the action on the strip but returning to a quiet comfortable place in the evening, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dianalynn8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, convenient to the strip, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Everytime we entered or left the building at least one of the staff members was smiling and telling us to have a good day or evening. it is located right behind the Flamingo and with a short trip around the pool area, and through the casino, you are on the strip. It was a quiet and relaxing trip when we wanted it to be, or we could head out towards the strip for lots of excitement. We definately will be going back to this hotel. Thanks to all who worked there ane helped to make our trip worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: calidave
Reviews.Content: We had a "guys": trip to Vegas in May. The resort is in a great location, just behind the flamingo hotel and right next to the monorail. The rooms were top notch and had everything we needed, full kitchen, huge jacuzzi tub. You have use of the giant Flamingo pool, with it's waterfalls, watersides, and gambling area. I find I can stay at this property much cheaper than the typical nicer strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Like home but on the strip”
Reviews.Author: AARVacations
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that was conveniently located on the strip but had the amenities of home since we were traveling with a 12 and 8 yr olds. The room had a fully equipped kitchen which was very nice for those "at home" meals which we took advantage of and washer and dryer. The hotel has a little market which was a little pricey but well worth it when you consider how much you would spend on eating out 3 meals a day. We woke up early every morning to reserve our pool chairs near some shade. If you wait...you may not get one. The pool area gets pretty crowded. We found that mostly those traveling with children would sit by the water slides which was nice. The slides kept the kids busy for hours. The main pool had mostly the young, drinking crowd. If you are traveling with a family or like the peacefulness of a non-casino hotel then this it your spot. You will truly enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: We4travelers
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best vacations my husband & I have had in Las Vegas. We had banked our own timeshare and requested a trade into this one based upon its location & reviews and were not disappointed. The whole stay was great! From check-in to check-out, the staff was helpful and so friendly. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it had everything we needed to feel at home here. As a previous review mentioned, the shower door did not fit tightly so we had a leak. A call to the front desk resulted in a prompt visit from a young man in maintenance who fixed the problem. There is a small grocery store at the timeshare which made for some leisurely breakfasts before hitting the pool area (we also found another place about a block away that had a bit more variety - out the main door and to the right). The pool area is not very big so we did need to get down there early to get a lounger. We had planned to use the pool at the Flamingo hotel as that was also available to timeshare guests but found it too crowded and noisy so spent our time at our own pool. We thoroughly enjoyed our week at the HGVC at the Flamingo and hope to stay there on our next stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Xenawantsapony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were evenutally moved to this hotel by our timeshare company when our stay at the Hilton on the Strip went badly. As a timeshare affiliate, this resort is great. The location is fantastic as it is right behind the Flamingo Hotel (basically on the other side of the bird sanctuary and main pool) which is pretty central on the strip. The building itself is a little dated, but the rooms are nice and have all the amenities you need. Housekeeping service is good. The concierge service was okay-we actually found better prices by going on-line at the business centre and booking the shows we wanted to see that way. The noise factor in the room was reasonable- we couldn't hear people in the hallways or in their own rooms, but we did hear noise from the pool areas during the day. The beds were reasonably comfortable but not as plush as the beds and bedding in many Hilton Hotels. The shower door did not close/fit properly so there was a big mess in the room every time you showered. Guests here had their own pool, children's pool and hot tub, but could also use the large pool intended for guests of the Flamingo Hilton. The pool at the timeshare was not usually very busy, but the hot tub could get crowded. The pool at the Flamingo Hilton was always packed and always had music playing. The pools and hot tubs do not stay open through the evenings (closed around 6). The pools are not heated so it was chilly getting into them in March. There was a little store where you could pick up basic groceries at the timeshare but it was just as easy to walk over to the Flamingo Hotel to pick up some take out at the Voga Terrace or try one of their restaurants (I would recommend the breakfast buffet at the Paradise Buffet). The bird sanctuary at the Flamingo Hotel is nice to walk through. The monorail runs across the back of the property and the city bus runs down the strip in front of the Flamingo Hotel. I would definitely recommend staying here because the resort is nice but mainly for the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nj_halsall
Reviews.Content: We have just come back after going to Vegas for a friends wedding. We went with my parents ( we are in our 30's) and had a great two suite apartment so we could come and go as we pleased without disturbing them. Our smaller room had a Kkng size bed with jacuzzi bath and a small kitchenette area with sink and fridge. The large main room had seperate bedroom, bathroom, toilet/sink area and kitchen/dining/ living area with the kitchen having all you could need including washer, dryer and dishwasher. The staff were very helpful and although the pool for this hotel is small it is good if you want a quieter area, the sunbeds are comfy and always towels available. If want more swimming can use the Flamingo pool which is quite large. The shop was a great convenience and the hotel was easily accessible to the Strip for sightseeing. Great trip for us all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vegas Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rndthewrld
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. We had a full kitchen, nicely stock with cooking necessities. I only would suggest they replace some of the well-used utensils. There was a stacked washer and dryer, fold out sofa bed and plenty of fresh towels. The bathroom has two separate counters with sinks and plenty of counter space. The jetted tub is huge and circular; made for two but could fit more if you want to. No complaints about the room. The entire interior was recently updated so all is nice, clean and new. The pool is small but quiet and relaxing with a full bar and misters. The Flamingo pool, which Hilton guests have full access to is a very crowded, mostly young scene. It is nice to be able to choose between the two pools. On weekdays the Go Pool at the Flamingo is not at all crowded. There is loud music and a bar with plenty of free lounges. It is $10 for men to get in and bikini tops are optional. There were very few who went topless. The small mini-mart and deli at the Hilton is convenient and has good Starbucks espresso drinks. The center strip location is excellent! It is a short walk over LV Blvd to Cesars and Bellagio. THe Venetian also isn't too bad a walk. To walk much further in the summer Vegas heat isn't fun. We took the monorail from Flamingo/HGVC a lot. There is an elevator right to the monorail stop outside the main lobby of Hilton or there's a bridge that goes from the Flamingo alongside the pool area to the monorail. It will take you as far as MGM Grand and Sahara. There is a free monorail if you walk across the street from the MGM to Excalibur. This one goes from Excalibur to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. If you want to be on the strip for some Vegas action this is the perfect spot! There is an Albertson's a short ($10 ?) cab ride away and a liquor and convenience store just behind the Hilton. We really enjoyed Pure at Cesars, dinner at the Voodoo Lounge on top of the Rio (excellent steaks! and view!), and the Thunder from Down Under show at the Excalibur. The show was perfect for a bachelorette party. Its a little cheesy but definitely a fun time. If you have a large group (6 or more people) the limos can be cheaper than cabs. They will negotiate on weeknights. In case you haven't already heard tell the cab driver to take Paradise Road to and from the airport and not the freeway. It is about the same amount of time and about $12-$15 instead of $25. Also, it is illegal for cabs and limos to stop on the strip to pick people up. It is well enforced so don't bother. Go to a hotel taxi stand for a cab or limo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: jacobh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at the Flamingo for 3 nights after moving from The Hilton Grand Vacation Club near the Stratsosphere. (We had planned to do this.) The rooms were luxurious, comfortable, convienent to The Strip and had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. We enjoyed the private members pool, workout room and convience store. We liked being more central on the Strip as we are walkers. We were completely satisfied with our accomodations and are happy to recommend this establishment as a great central place to stay on The Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ElaineT1
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay. Rooms have all you need kitchen, washer dryer, large bathroom, flat screen, dvd player etc. Quiet too. For 4th of July we stayed 2 nights - around $250. Self parking a bit of a trek. Shuttle available to airport if needed. Just off the Strip. Behind The Flamingo. Private pool area is small and not well kept. But you can move over to The Flamingo pool - much larger with water shutes. Gets very noisy and extremely busy with the younger and drunker crowds later in the day. Deli very good and reasonable price. Staff helpful and friendly. Had dinner at Mon Ami at the Paris - we sat outside and watched fireworks and the Bellagio fountains. You have to wait quite a while for seating, but if you're in no hurry it's worth it. Great food - reasonable price. Great staff. 2nd night went to Tournament of Kings at the Excalibur - great for the kids and good value again - includes food and soft drinks. Show's a bit cheesy but the kids loved the jousting and horses. and eating with your fingers. Had fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mom5Oceanside
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about the staff at this hotel. Their willingness to accommodate me began with my initial phone call to make the reservation to my request for another room after my first night. Again, the staff was great and should probably give tips on service to some of the staff working in some of the other restaurants and hotels in Vegas . The suite was clean and spacious and the pool on the Hilton's grounds was a nice get away from the crowded, party atmosphere at the Flamingo's pool. I will definitely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Calm Yet Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: Saluga
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of this hotel. It’s right behind the Flamingo, so we just had to walk around the pool area and through the Flamingo casino to get to the Strip. Our room was a king studio suite with a nice view of the pool and gardens. It was a good size with a kitchenette, Jacuzzi, sofa bed and flat screen TV. The hotel was very quiet. There were people staying in the next room, and we never heard them at all. There’s a fee to use the computers, but it’s free to print out an airline boarding pass. The front desk staff was extremely nice. We asked if we could have a late check out since our plane wasn’t leaving until the afternoon, and they gave it to us without a problem. There was a deli that sold sandwiches and snacks, along with various sundry items. Self parking was free in a garage across the street, but there was a charge for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LAT10258
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5-night stay here and would certainly return there the next time we go to Las Vegas. We arrived at midday and despite check-in being 4pm we were given our room straight away. Check-in was very quick and efficient. We were in the North Tower which was smaller and were told also quieter than the main building - it was ideal for us. We were on the 8th floor so had great view from our window, over the pool area. When we arrived there was coffee etc in our room. Bathroom amenities were shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap, all replaced daily. We booked a King bed studio room and this was very spacious and ideal for us. As there is so much to do in LV you don't spend much time in your room. The room had a large jacuzzi bath and wash hand basin open onto main area with a separate shower and WC. Maid service was excellent, though their duties don't include washing / drying of dishes. The pool area is not very big but still very pleasant. Guests can also use the Flamingo pool and although this was much bigger it was always extremely busy and very noisy. There is a deli on the ground floor where you can buy all basic essentials. We preferred to go to the nearby grocery store, 2 minute walk from the front door of the hotel. Here prices were cheaper. e.g. bottle of wine was $13 instead of $20 at the deli, water was $1 instead of $3. There are 2 computers available for guest use, at a small charge. All staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a perfect location, only 2 minute walk to the Strip. We took a taxi to Premium outlets, $16 - 20. Taxi to airport was $16. Buses are very easy to use on the Strip - at $7 for a day pass they are great value. Will certainly return here when we are next fortunate to be able to go back to LV.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with large rooms for families.”
Reviews.Author: Izzy14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo for 4 nights while visiting the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. The location on the Strip is great. The rooms are very spacious. Our room had a large bedroom with King size bed and then a seperate living area with a pull out queen sofa which accomodated our two young boys. It also had a fully equipted kitchen and washing maching and dryer which was very useful. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and allowed us a late check out to fit in with our flight out of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious elegant accomodations in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kimborob
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip the USA where we flew into Las Vegas and stayed for 2 nights in a 2 bedroom suite. I am an HGVC member and had used points to pay for the 2 nights. i think it may be quite costly if you are not a member though, but I can understand why. I am an owner at Coylumbridge and have come to expect excellent accomodation and facilities with HGVC but was still impressed at what we found. We were on the 17th floor in the main tower and looked out towards the Flamingo Hotel, gardens and swimming pools. Entry to the suite (which is for 6 but comfortably sleeps 8) was via double doors, into a small vestibule and there were then 2 seperate entrances, one led to a spacious studio suite with king bed, double sofa bed, large flat screen TV, small kitchenette, large open plan jacuzzi bath and dressing area and seperate shower room. The other door led into a one bedroom apartment with full open plan kitchen with marble worktops, all cooking facilites, cutlery, crockery, glasses etc, fridge, freezer, dischwasher, washing machine and tumble drier. There was a double sofa bed, two armchairs, large flat screen TV in the living area and a dining table and 4 chairs in a recess. The king bedroom was enormous with lots of storage space, large flat screen TV, large dressing area with his and hers sink units and a large jacuzzi bathtub. There was a seperate shower room and a further vanity area, again with double sinks. The beds were extremely comfortable with plenty of additional linen, towels etc supplied. All the accomodations, public and outside area's were immaculately presented, and far exceeded our expectations. There was a private, members only fitness room, indoor hottub, outdoor swimming pool and spa with comfortable sun loungers and furniture, towels supplied in abundance. Nice garden area's with covered area's and furniture with gas barbeque's for members use. There was a small onsite grocery store, coffee shop and deli. All in all, 5 star accomodation, friendly, helpful staff and only steps away from the central area of Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_needed_now
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 day stay at HGVC @ the Flamingo. We found the location to be excellent - it is only a few minutes walk past the pool and through the Flamingo casino and you are right in the middle of the strip opposite Caesers Palace. Being set back from the strip meant that the hotel felt more peaceful, so it was nice to come back to after a busy day. I used the pool area once and found it well equipped with comfortable sunbeds, plenty of towels, a small bar and a big jacuzzi as well as the pool. The pool area felt quite luxurious in comparison to the Flamingo's pool, which was much bigger but felt crowded and noisy. We had a one bed apartment, with a jacuzzi which was great. The apartment was comfortable and well equipped (eg well stocked kitchen, coffee machine, useful washer and dryer). Our room was refurbished room and not at all pink which was a relief! The only downside was that the place is fairly anonymous, and you're not staying in a recreation of Venice, New York etc as in some of the other hotels. However we had a really comfortable stay, and enjoyed the relative peace of HGVC. The great location would particularly encourage us to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great location, doof for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: auroraclubjazz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HGVC Flamingo 3/22 - 3/27 2009. I had a studio room on the 16th floor. the room was very spacious. I enjoyed having a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. there is an excellent whirlpool bath set up - there is a large opening between the bathtub and the main room, so you can have a good soak and watch TV if you want. There is a separate private shower and toilet area. The TV was a flat screen of decent size (42" ?) and the channel selection was good. service was good - daily maid service and friendly staff all around. Small grocery store and deli on the premises was useful, fair prices and good food and excellent coffee. What really makes this place special is its location. It is at the backside of the Flamingo Hotel, and all the rooms overlook the Flamingo's expansive tropical pool grounds. You can use the flamingo pool (good for kids) if you want to hang with the crowd, or you can use the HGVC's small pool and hot tub. I chose to use the HGCV pool as the flamingo pool had all of the sunny chairs taken. There were kids in teh HGVC pool and they seemed to enjoy it. An earlier post on this site refers to the HGVC chairs all being "reserved" first thing in the morning. As far as I can tell, what really happens is that staff puts a rolled up towel on each chaise first thing in the morning and they are not being held for anyone. Great little pool bar too with reasonable prices. The grounds immediately adjacent to the hotel are a nice place to have coffee in the morning. I used the monorail to get to the convention center each day. The monorail is right behind the HGVC. It is a little convoluted to get to it as you have to exit the Flamingo pool, enter the Flamingo, and then backtrack along the monorail walkway. Not too far and the monorail comes at least every 10 minutes. I also found a really good pizza place in the Flamingo, over by the actual flamingo (the birds) exhibit. I got take out so I could watch a movie in my room and have a pizza and a couple of cold beers. Speaking of beer, I found a small microbrewery place in the Flamingo too - with stout on tap, which seems to be pretty hard to find in this town. The strip is readily accessible through the Flamingo hotel. I found it enjoyable to walk the strip and then take the monorail back and vice-versa. I would recommend the HGVC for business travelers as it is quiet and they have free internet access and can print your boarding passes. I would also recommend this for families, though I can't really imagine bringing my kids to Vegas. The Flamingo pool is the big family draw and the HGVC provides access to excellent pools and the all the Vegas sites without having to expose your kids to really drunk 20-somethings. I am not giving the HGVC five stars because it is not a five star hotel. However, it is a solid four star in my book. I've stayed at the Golden Nugget (a four-start hotel), which is a low four star in my book, and the HGVC room and service quality are better. It just doesn't have all the bells and whistles (restaurants, nightlife, spa etc.) that must be required to be a four-star. Not all was perfect and I have a few pet peeves. Bed was hotel standard - not one of those dream beds you get in some places. Nice down comforter and pillows though. Couch was a twin fold-out, and I find fold-out couches to be uncomfortable to sit on. I would have much preferred a good solid leather chair or two but I guess they are going for maximizing the guest bed potential. The TV is always pre-tuned to the commercial for the HGVC membership, which wouldn't be too annoying but the volume preset is too loud. The DVD player is a great touch, but the DVD rental kiosk downstairs was busted so I was at the mercy of TBS. On business trips I like to splurge for the overpriced new releases on demand and I was looking forward to watching the new Bond movie, but the HGVC doesn't offer on-demand and the DVD kiosk selection, when working, is limited. The room shares a private foyer with the adjacent one-bedroom condo. The foyer door is keyed too which is nice if you want to rent out the whole two bedroom set-up for a larger group. However, both the foyer door and the two split unit doors close really loud, and on my last night my new neighbors were coming and going from 11PM to midnight (they had friends in another unit, had just gotten in and were situating - yup I heard all their conversations in the foyer) and the loud doors kept me awake. I could not hear their conversations once they went into their room. The key positive to me was the grounds - being able to sit outside and relax surrounded by vegetation and no crowds. I could not find any other hotel on my strip wanderings that offered such a relaxing outdoor area. They all seem to focus on the indoors, or close their pool areas at 5 (nice move for business people), or are so crowded as to not be relaxing. So, if you are still bothering to read this rather lengthy review, I hope this has been of help in making your decision. It is a mellow hotel and is a good choice for mellow people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: joceylou
Reviews.Content: My father allowed me use of his timeshare at the Hilton Grand Vacation at the Flamingo March 7-14, 2009. The rooms were recently remodeled and were wonderful. There was an issue two days with hot water. There had been problems with the boiler and it had been replaced. We had to call twice and an engineer was sent up. One night we had to take cold showers. Other than that the issue was handled wonderfully and the staff were very cordial. The location is fantastic. A nice stroll through the Flamingo's wildlife habitat brings you to the Flamingo hotel and casino with direct access to the strip...right in the center! The room viewed the pool and Flamingo hotel. It was very quiet yet close to the activity if desired. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: lesilek48
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the HGVC Flamingo and absolutely loved the renovated rooms. The granite counters, and cherry wood cabinets really improved the decore, along with new tile, flooring, and furniture. Service was excellent and the front desk was very accomodating in allowing for early check in and having our friends on the same floor. We enjoyed the deli/store on the first floor. Very good breakfast wraps and sandwiches which were very reasonable. It was nice to have a relaxing breakfast in the room as opposed to waiting in line at the cafe in the Flamingo Hilton. The pool and hottub area was very nice and an even bigger bonus was that the pool was heated, A nice perk when the weather is only in the 60's with very cool nights. The locatation is also an asset to this property as it it centrally located on the strip (behind the Flamingo Hilton) and has a monorail stop on the property if you do not have a rental car. We certainly look forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: heybrah
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights with my family at a two bedroom suite at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at the Flamingo. The two bedroom suite is really a one bedroom and a studio with a combined entry way. The staff was helpful - including the pn-site concierge who got us some good deals for shows. The property is "off the strip" and shares the pool area with the Flamingo. The weather was junk while we were there - cold but the HGVC pool and hot tub were heated and open, while the Flamingo pool was closed. Valet parking is $9 a day but there is free parking in a parking garage shared with O'shea's and the Imperial Palace. We self parked and had no problems finding space. The property does not have a casino which is a nice respite from some of the casino hotels. There is a small but well stocked canteen but there were groceries nearby (~3 miles) if you planned to cook. The kitchen in the one bedroom was well fixed - full size stove and refrigerator, plus a microwave. We cooked breakfasts to keep the costs down. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at this Non-Casino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business convention for 3 nights. Had a very nice corner 1 bedroom suite on the 8th floor facing the east and the airport. Check-in was very efficient and felt very secure when you have to enter your key 24 hours a day to get to your floor. Pros: During the winter months, the Flamingo Pool is Closed, but this hotel has its own pool and hottub that is open from 6am-10pm daily. The hotel has its own entrance so you don't have to mess with the Flamingo Hotel traffic. The proximity to the monorail is great right in front of hotel. Room was very comfortable and had a whirlpool tub as well as a walk-in shower . The front desk and lobby area are very big and they have a motorized piano playing nice music. The hotel has a small grocery type store and sandwich making place as well. Cons: Upon checking in i was told i could show my white charge card and charge things to my room,but after going to numerous restaurant and shops at the Flamingo that was indeed not the case (nor had it for over a month) Brought it to the attention of the front desk and was told that they would look into it. Note: I would stay here again though since the hotel is mid-strip and close to a lot of things and restaurants. The

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: hot4travelLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Just returned 23/11/2008 My wife and I have stayed in a few hotels in Vegas over the years including Golden Nugget, Ceasers Palace M G M and this R C I exchange was the best thing we could have done. It was better than any hotel we have stayed in and the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: letsgetgoing
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI trade. I had never stayed in Las Vegas before for vacation so I was not sure what to expect. We checked in late Sunday evening and it went very smooth. We had rented a car and the valet was great. Cheap money for the week, about $40 and easy access. Also since HGVC at Flamingo is behind the Flamingo, street access is simple. You do not need to drive down the strip. We were the first ones in a newly renovated 2 bedroom suite. 42" flat screen tvs in the living room and studio and a smaller flat screen on the wall of the master bedroom. All upgraded granite counters. New furniture. Everything was great. Both rooms had jacuzzi tubs and separate showers. The new shower heads had no pressure adjustments and stung when you used them. If they had a way of turning down the water pressure or using an adjustable head, I think it would have been better. The only other thing that I would prefer they changed is the old 1970 hotel style heating and cooling. The temperature gauge went from cool to heat. Then there is the switch for low, medium and high fan and another switch for low, medium and off. I would prefer a thermostat with a temperature setting that allows the fan to turn off, but otherwise it functioned fine. You have complete access to the Flamingo pool, but since we were there the end of September, the pool closed at 4pm because it is "OFF SEASON"...although it was 96 degrees out.. Strange.... HGVC also has their own pool next to the Flamingo pool. It is fenced off and only accessible to guests of HGVC. It is smaller with a hot tub, small bar for drinks and a nice pool. It is much quieter and open until 10pm. This was great. The people at the HGVC were excellent. Always smiling, always saying hello and very helpful. Any issues we had were addressed almost immediately. My brother in law was in a wheel chair and we were able to rent an electric scooter type chair in the lobby. The bellman, Jesus, helped us get a good discount off the original listed price and we appreciated his help. There is a a deli that has good food and is reasonably priced. Overall, I would stay there without question. The place, the people and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas without the crowds and noise”
Reviews.Author: markotoole
Reviews.Content: The major complaint about Vegas hotels is the crowds and casinos one must deal with when simply trying to get to your room. Hilton GVC eliminates all that. The hotel is attached to the Flamingo, so you share all the Flamingo's amenities, like their great pool, zoo and casinos. Even better, the hotel is right on the monorail stop. But best of all, the hotel has its own entrance, no casino and terrific rooms. The hotel is a suite hotel. Upgrade to the one-bedrrom and get a sepearate kitchen (a huge one at that), sitting area, bedroom, free wi-fi, private pool, sundry shop with affordable prices, and friendly staff. Check-in was a breeze, the room was clean and quiet, and I could be in the Flamingo or on the Strip in two minutes. Vegas is about the shows and gambling, but the Hilton GVC proves you can still enjoy a quiet, sopisticated room while enjoying Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TheNeeces
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Grand Vacations Club members and LOVE this property! We planned a wedding for our daughter who is in her 30's and didn't want a big ceremony - Vegas came up as a fun destination where she could be married without a lot of formality - What a great time we had. We had a small wedding at one of the local chapels, then returned to the Hilton for the reception, where we had food platters catered to the poolside - Mr. Tom Hickman and the staff there were so nice and handled it all!! They kept the pool bar open for us and it was all PERFECT. They handled everything via phone and fax and I could not have been more pleased- the location is the best part of this property - short walk to the Flamingo casino, monorail stop or anywhere else you want to go. Sure, some of the rooms are dated, but who's in the room!! The staff is super at this property and everything is always clean and well maintained. We've had nothing but good service and wonderful times every time we visit. We have not stayed at the other two Hilton timeshare properties due to the convenience of staying at this one! We never rent a car when we go to Vegas. If we're going somewhere too far to walk, we take the bus or a cab . Always great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Hot week in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wags1998
Reviews.Content: We spent the week at the Hilton Grand Vacation at the Flamingo during the week of 7/27-8/2. The average temperature for the week was 105 degrees. Check-in was smooth; we stayed in the North tower, on the fifth floor. Attached are some pictures from our room. The room was clean and spacious. There was a Jacuzzi bath tub for two next to the queen size bed. There was his and hers sinks. The maid service came once on Wednesday, it was complementary. We paid to have the car valet for the week. It cost $40; I think it was worth the fee. I believe the parking garage is a ways away from the Hilton. We had full use of the Flamingo's pool. It opened everyday at 8 AM. By 8:30 the Flaming pool would be near capacity. The pool at the Hilton was nice as well. They have a bar located by the poolside, as well as cabanas with misters. They also have a gas grill that you can use; we chose not to use the grill. We ate out during our trip. The Flamingo casino was about a 7-10 minute walk from our room. Caesars casino was about a 10 minute walk as well. There is a side street behind the Hilton which takes you to center strip. I've been to Vegas many times, and for a timeshare, this is by far the best location because of the proximity to the strip. The Hilton also has store which is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE - Filthy - SLOW”
Reviews.Author: miahac
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Hiliton Grand vacations club at the Flamingo in Las Vegas I surprised to find my shoe stuck in a pile of human feces while walking down the hall from my elevator to my room. The management took 45 minutes to clean it up, would not clean or replace my shoes and repeatedly accused me of being the one deficating on the floor. The other members of my bachelor party were with me when we were returning from the casino at 8am and can certainly vouch that the crap was left by someone other than me. I have video proof I will be posting when I find the place to upload.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great city”
Reviews.Author: leavingNJ
Reviews.Content: We bought a time share at the grand vacations club and I was very very impressed. Let me tell you one thing that may change your minds about this hotel. It does not have a casino, nightclub, or any of that jazz. The hotel is classy, with big rooms and a nice location. The hotel has a shared property with the Flamingo, so you are free to use their pool (incredible I may add), casino, and all of their features. The location is superb. The monorail is right outside your door, and although you are not "on" the strip, the flamingo is right next to caesar's palace, Bellagio, Bally's and many others. Great hotel great location, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Thermastat Nighmare”
Reviews.Author: askll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flamingo Hilton fron April 27 through May 1, 2008. Check in process was excellent. We were given a room upgrade by booking on Expedia. The upgraded room were rooms above the 8th floor which were recently renovated. It was a gorgeous room with a large flat-screen HD TV, large walk-in shower, new bed and furnishings. The only MAJOR problem with the room was the thermastat. They were motion-generated thermostats, which means that the air-conditioner only came on when there was motion in the room. For instance, if you left the room and there was no motion, upon your return, your room temperature would go back up to 80. There was also no air conditioning when you were sleeping. It got so hot in our room at night, that I had to waive my hand in front of the scensor every ten minutes to activate it. When I called for maintenance, they told me that there was no way to turn off the scensor. If you do decide to go to the Flamingo Hilton, make sure you ask for one of the old rooms with the normal thermastats. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: Upstatenyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week during April 13 -19 2008. Check in process was excellent and after refusing a 2nd floor suite we were upgraded to 7th floor at no charge. One bedroom suite was just what we wanted and had a great view of the pool area's of HGVC and Flamigo. Access to Flamigo's pools was great. Non casino environment and distance from the strip was a plus at night. Proximity to strip was a plus during the day. Short walk through or around Flamingo and you were in the heart of the strip. Used the free parking just off the hotel and was not a problem at all and saved $8 per day on valet. There was always a space in garage reserved for HGVC guests. Hotel staff was just fabulous, and friendly. Deli in hotel was small but had great food and coffee (starbucks). Kept the coffee cup as refills were much less expensive. Rented a car and had easy access to the main roads in each direction. ie..30 min to Hoover, 4.5 hours to South rim, 35 min. to Red Rock Canyon...etc.. Did not use the monorail as it seemed quite pricey and walking the strip was very easy as long as you have good sneakers. Saw Spamalot and Ka and walked both ways to each show. Would recommend both but get twofers at Travelzoo or someplace else. Was at HGVC with two teenage boys and they both enjoyed the place also. Played tennis and enjoyed the pools on off travel days. I think they are closing around July 1 for renovations but we loved our room with the full kitchen, washer/dryer, BLENDER, etc.....would highly recommend this hotel for anyone...price was right also.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything, and Good for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: JPuppy1234
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay at. This is just what i wanted. It had warm water to take a shower, comfortable bed, and close to everything. To me thats most important when your only spending 10 hours in it.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC - great property close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Danspeanut
Reviews.Content: My husband being active duty Army, we took advantage of Hilton's "Vactions for Veterans" program and stayed 3 nights at the HGVC - Flamingo for free. Hard to beat. I thought they would put us in an older room. But we arrived at noon, well in advance of check-in and not only was our room ready but it was newly redecorated with a great view of the pool area and the Strip. Full kitchen, king bed, great view--You couldn't ask for more. Every staff member went out of their way to be kind to us (especially the valet and the front desk) and the conceirge made reservations for me at the Flamingo spa no problem. The room was clean, neat, and well-appointed. Jacuzzi tub for 2! The only issue is parking. Self park is a good 10 minute walk from the room and accessibly only from the outside. That would be terrible in summer. Pay the $6/day rate for valet and come and go as you like. No restaurant on the property but the Flamingo is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms...ugh! But everything else is pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Rooms - The rooms are very dated and way below Hilton standards...don't be swayed by the Hilton name! It is much more similiar to a Comfort Inn. Plus, really noisy doors when you stay in the studio rooms! Positives: Location - You just need to walk through The Flamingo to be on The Strip. Pool - You have access to the Flamingo's pool with the "resorty" poolside waitress service and waterfall,etc...nice enough but it is crowded and smokey with loud music. The Hilton's pool is small but nice and less noisey. The pool bar is GREAT. Frozen drinks were $4.50 vs. $10 at the Flamingo and $12 at the Wynn! Deli - The on-site deli was great and a nice break from the Vegas-over-the-top-prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - okay property”
Reviews.Author: mkirch72
Reviews.Content: This is one of the timeshare properties for Hilton Grand Vacations Club (HGVC). I was told this is one of their original properties, purchased around 1994. It is on the grounds of the Flamingo Las Vegas. However, we discovered that they are no longer affiliated in any way. Hilton has a much newer, nicer property at the north end of the strip, but you can't beat this one's location. It is on the strip behind the Flamingo which is next to Bally's and Paris and across the street from Caeser's and Bellagio. Check-in was good, however the parking for HGVC is actually about a five to ten minute walk to the Flamingo's employee garage which has NO ELEVATOR'S, and guests can only park on level three or higher (because this is the employee garage for the Flamingo). It would have been nice to have been told this by the check-in desk. Do yourself a favor and drop you bags off at your room first if you're parking a car. And be careful because the walk is behind the Flamingo on an access road that doesn't always have a sidewalk. Imagine walking in the street in Vegas with luggage while delivery trucks and taxi's speed by. It is the most ridiculous parking situation I've ever seen -- but it's free! The HGVC has it's own pool/jacuzzi area which is separate from the Flamingo. This is a good thing as the Flamingo pool area was always extremely crowded with hundreds of people and lots of kids (as well as really murky, cloudy water). The HGVC has a deli/market open until 10pm with a pretty extensive variety of items. Think of it as a cross between a small convenience store and Starbucks. It also serves breakfast sandwiches, wraps, subs, and pizza. And if you're an owner you get a 10% discount on all purchases. Our unit was a one bedroom apartment. On the plus side, it was a good size and was extremely clean. On the negative side, the decor was obviously inspired by the Flamingo in the early 90's and has a Golden Girls pink/green theme. The stove and microwave in the kitchen were functional, but old. The bathroom was enormous, with an extremely large jacuzzi tub that easily fit two people. However, the sinks and tub were very dated. My biggest complaint was the sofa in the living room was very old and had multiple stains. I have one complaint in terms of service --- the binder in your rooms that explains "owner" benefits include a 10% discount at all restaurants at the adjoining Flamingo Las Vegas as well as any Flamingo Las Vegas logo items from their gift store. As I mentioned earlier, the Flamingo and HGVC are no longer affiliated in any way and the Flamingo did not honor this 10% discount AT ALL. I brought this to the attention of someone at the check-in desk and she shrugged her shoulder's and said, "Yeah, it's real hit or miss. The manager is trying to work something out with them. You can fill out a comment card if you want". I told her it was not the fact that the Flamingo wasn't honoring it, it was the fact that the binder in my room says they are! Change the binders if you no longer have an agreement! I realize this is not a huge issue, but it irked me. Overall, this property is for you if you are interested in a central location on the strip. It's clean and spacious and the staff were (overall) extremely friendly and helpful. However, the property itself is not up to HGVC standards and could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: bestplanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. Definitely use the valet as its saves you walking to the garage. The guys were so helpful and fast. No lines here and the pool was never crowded. We tried the Flamingo Pool one day and you had to get a chair by 8am or forget it. The Flamingo had what looked like a million people in their pool by noon. So we came back to Hilton pool and there were chairs and about 7 people in the pool. The rooms here are soooo big and clean. 1 bedroom with kitchen and liv/din and a huge jacuzzi. I would recommend this to all and come back to this Hilton. Its close to the strip. Wear sneakers as you walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK stay”
Reviews.Author: pleasantbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Flamingo - HGVC - from 7-8 thru 7-15-07. 104 to 114 degrees that week. We stayed here for a week through an RCI exchange. This was just an OK experience. Stayed at other 'resorts' and had better times - Loved past stay at the Mandalay Bay on the Strip! Arrived in Las Vegas and rented a car since we planned to go out and about to sight see (Hoover Dam - Lake Mead - etc). Self parking is free - valet parking for the week is $30 - plus your wait time. The property is located behind the Flamingo Casino (Hilton Flamingo... Hilton GVC...). Walking distance to Bally's, Harrah's, Bellagio etc. If you want to go along the Strip and see the various casino's - purchase a 24-hour monorail ticket ($9) since there is a station connected at the Flamingo. Monorail runs from MGM to the Sahara. There is a separate monorail that runs from the Excalibur to Mandalay Bay. Reserved a 2 bedroom unit which turned out to be a 'Master Unit Room' and general 'hotel room' attached. This composed of two bedrooms (king beds) with TVs, w/a DVD or VCR and a sleeper sofa, two hot tubs (a single and double), two shower stalls, small kitchen, dining table, sleeper sofa and living room area with a TV. Beds were super firm, basic 'hotel' type bedding - nothing dreamy or super fluffy about them. Couch had minor stains from leftovers. Walls were dirty with handprints and food stains in the kitchen. Dishwasher, coffee makes, toaster, etc. Sub par cleaning performed or at least to my personal cleaning standards. Room overlooked the pool and faced Bally's. Towels in unit are basic hotel towels - nothing fluffy or luxury about them. Elevator had foul order. Washer dryer in the unit is super small efficiency type. Two shirts, two shorts and maybe a pair of undergarments was pushing it's capacity. HGVC provides dish soap, single use laundry soap box, 2 -1oz coffee packets, 2 dishwasher packets, bathroom soaps and shampoo/conditioners, 1 paper towel roll. Nice touch. The staff were very nice. Registration Desk - Welcome Desk - Concierge - bellhops - pool bar staff - etc - everyone was very very nice. The picture of the resort is shot looking from the Flamingo Casino looking though landscaped trees into the Hotel court yard - pool area. You register behind all this off the drive up entrance to the Flamingo next to an alleyway. The HGVC has it's own pool (only 4 feet deep), a 15 person hot tub outside and a 8 person indoor tub. Small hotel size workout facility. Guest also have the usage of the Flamingo pool and grounds. The Flaming has a very large pool (3.5 - 4 feet deep only), life guards, has a kids slide at one end, a separate European sunbathing area - adults only & a pair of tennis courts. About the pool area - When we were there, adults would go down to the HGVC pool starting around 6am to reserve Cabana's (there is a total of 5 available - they have fans and water-misters) and chairs. Very annoying since it was the same families time after time. I complained to the pool staff and had their items removed from the Cabana since the family left for the other Flamingo pool for over 2 hours while leaving their item within the cabana. A lot of kids, a lot of teenagers and young adults. Loud music plays at both pools. Heavy smoking going on around the pools too.. since the HGVC is non-smoking inside. 2nd hand smoke all around the pool. Parents at times put their kids - in diapers - into the pool - GROSS! When we were their - a child (4/5) swallowed too much pool water and puked his lunch into the pool. Hence it was shut down and needed to be cleaned for the day... There is a small deli on site - good food at a nice price. There is a pool bar, $5 for weak drinks though. Nice bar tenders.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back any day”
Reviews.Author: mountainmama07
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas, and can't say enough about a GREAT place to great stay ! Middle of the strip (had a rented van, but never used it during our 4 days there) with PEACEFUL gardens & spacious room to relax . Hotel shares tropical garden & pools & water slides / falls with the Flamingo; alot happening there, but nice to come back to the peace of this hotel. Great staff, clean rooms, easy access to room, workout room, small deli with good breakfast sandwhiches. Went with our 3 kids (ages 14 - 22) to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and everyone loved being able to spread out in the room, even my reluctant outdoorman husband. From here headed to Grand Canyon, Sedona, Mesa Verde and S. Utah national parks after; Vegas is a great start and stop point.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like some time off the strip and still be there in a minute”
Reviews.Author: KBLA
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel close to all the action and still nice and quiet. The hilton Hotel staff was nice and courtesy, however I found the cleaning not good and was amazed to find bottles from customers before me! The room comes with jacuzzi, nice kitchen area as well as a soft and comfortable bed. Idue to cleanliness I don't give them top ratings!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice timeshare, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Wombatkev
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice timeshare that is also rented out on a daily basis. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was very spacious and comfortable with full kitchen and laundry facilities, 2 jacuzzis, living and dining area. Location is excellent, just behind the Flamingo (which is in the midst of all the action) and is easily accessible via the Flamingo's sprawling pool area (also open to HGVC guests). There is also a smaller pool exclusively for guests. There is a small deli on site and 2 internet computers on the ground floor, with a small charge. Decor is a little dated though, with shades of floral pink throughout. The HGVC is a very good option for those who prefer a more homely and family friendly environment rather than the busy and noisy atmosphere of a casino hotel. The half-price ticket booths (there's one at the Fashion Show Mall and another at the Coke Bottle building) are good value -- we saw Mamma Mia, among many others, for half price and it was excellent! The $5 a day deuce bus is also good value for traveling to the South or North Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant destination...Loads to do!!”
Reviews.Author: missclairmarshall
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks in Vegas last June, it was brilliant. We stayed in the Flamingo Hilton which was very reasonable..decided to stay here because it was one of the first hotels in Vegas...the original flamingo was built by Bugsy Segall. When we got there we had been allocated a terrible room, so I complained and got a free up-grade with fantastic views over the strip and opposite Ceasers palace. Thing I reccomend to do: Loads to do..We did the helicopter tip to the Canyon...well worth it!! Went on all the rollercoasters the Manhatten Express was fastastic and Stratosphere tower the rides are crazy!!! We saw many shows I can reccomend Jubilee, Ka (was amazing a must see) Blue Man group and mystere. Take as much money as you can cause there is soooo much to do. Go and see the sound and light show downtown at the old part of vegas it's cheaper to eat and drink there too. Shopping is fantastic...go to fashion show mall near Treasure Island. We hired a car and drove to death Vally and stopped off at the very eeerie junction, beautifl landscapes at furnace creek. We also went LA which was pretty cool. Go to Calico which is a little ghost town it's a bit touristy but quite good! Oh and go to the Hoover Dam visitor centre it's very interesting!!! I would definatly go back to Vegas but maybe for a week next time!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: docajenk
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all respects. We had a one bedroom suite which was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The location is perfect for the strip. Pool area very pleasant, access is restricted to residents only and hence is quieter and much more relaxing than the Flamingo pool, which you also have use of. Hotel also has an indoor and outdoor hot tub, sauna and small gym. There is a deli on sight which is not expensive to buy provisions. Above all the staff were always so friendly and helpful, with nothing being too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Alternative When Room Rates Soar”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for two nights in April, 2007, because casino hotel prices on the Strip were sky high. It is a pleasant place, delivering what it promises. We had a big room with sitting area, small kitchen, and spa bathtub. Our room was quiet and had a pleasing view of the Flamingo pool area and Strip. We found the best deal for parking is to use the valets at the Flamingo Hotel. They gave excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A nice timeshare property”
Reviews.Author: adeala
Reviews.Content: Since I had stayed at Hilton hotel last year, I got a phone solicitation from Hilton to come down to Vegas for a timeshare presentation. After the cash and food comps, the room cost me about $40 for a 2 night stay. The one bedroom suite was spacious and clean. It was also very quiet but that may have been because we had the room at the far south end of the 6th floor. We didn't share an entry way with a studio room like some of the other one bedroom suites did. The only problem with the room was the corner of the wallpaper by the shower was peeling up slightly. The maid service was great. They even did the dishes for us every day. And the timeshare presentation we got was very low pressure. But that may just have been our salesguy "Big Jim". Just telling him that we couldn't afford the 10% down seemed to be enough.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet - but beware of timeshare pitch!”
Reviews.Author: Mirth60
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Las Vegas for my birthday. Because I'm a Diamond Hilton member, he booked this place - not knowing it was a timeshare project. We were not upgraded upon check-in, but did receive deli coupons (for overpriced, inedible breakfat selections). The one-bedroom was great with an enormous, jetted tub. However, we were constantly awakened by our neighbors going in and out of their room. There is one central double door for two rooms - then another door once inside the central area. Be warned that this is not a regular hotel. The only maid service was changing of the towels and our bed being made. There is no other cleaning beyond that. There are no restaurants on property - only a deli with nasty, overpriced food. The staff was not informed on the restaurants or shows of the area. And the main activity of the place is selling timeshares. Be aware that if you refuse their first offer of "cash or chips" for 90 minutes of your time, they may up the ante (after all, this is Las Vegas)!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the HGVC at the Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: kalcansb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan.13th(Friday) thru Jan.16th(Monday). Had another nice stay here (first time was Aug 2002), we chose to return here mostly because I thought it was the most reasonable rate for a room with a jacuzzi. The location is excellent, you are a short walk to the Flamingo which I would say is about right in the middle of the strip. The monorail has a stop at the Flamingo(the monorail is pretty much in the parking lot of the HGVC) this was a surprise since it was not here in 2002. We did not ride the monorail since some friends of ours stayed here at the HGVC also, so it was cheaper just to take a quick cab ride. Both times we have stayed here we have never been bothered by the HGVC trying to sell us a timeshare, I wish I could say that for everywhere else we walked, it seems Vegas has discovered the timeshare in a big way. This time we did not have our children with us and had a studio instead of a 1 bedroom. Overall the 1 bedroom was better(duh) but still the studio was quite nice. Overall the stay was excellent and would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Crazy
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this Hilton. We stayed in a studio room (I am a Hilton gold but was not upgraded at check-in). The timeshare part of this hotel was on the verge of harassing, as they would call us in our room a few times a day leaving us message after message. The few times we were in the room and answered the phone, the gal wanted to know how many of us there were, was I there with my husband, etc. and she was very disappointed when finding out I was not interested in the timeshare part. Still, that did not stop the phone calls from continuing! Finally, after 4 days of this, I went down to the desk and asked to speak with the manager. She was very nice, understanding, and put an end to the phone calls for the rest of our trip. It's ironic that this hotel would push the timeshare here anyway as the towels are very thin (even had a few with substanital holes in them), the floor of our shower had part of the tile missing, and our bed was really hard,uncomfortable, and on two different days was made up with stained sheets! Definitely not up to par with the other Hiltons I have stayed in. The tub and the kitchenette were nice but didin't make up for the negatives. There are so many better hotels in Vegas. I won't be staying at this one again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo
HotelInfo.Address: 3575 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
